Friday 22 August, 6pm
The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Free event, all welcome
Come through or the FOMO will come for you!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Tangihanga, Created and performed by Kristyl Neho

Tangihanga is a solo drama-comedy centred around Jess - a devoted daughter whose father, Karanipa, has passed away. As Jess’ whānau gathers at the marae to mourn, tensions rise, secrets are revealed, and long-held family dynamics begin to unravel. Neho masterfully embodies over 30 characters, capturing the complexity of grief, cultural identity, and the strength of whānau. This bold, emotionally charged, and often hilarious performance speaks to the heart of Aotearoa.

“A graceful celebration of the power of theatre to create and tell a story.” - Tanya Piejus, Regional News

Audience care: Contains themes of grief and loss. Recommended for audiences aged 9+.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.
Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.
Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm
Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.
This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage, With 21 published nonfiction books, you’ll likely have come across Bill Bryson’s work. One of his most famous books, ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything’, has been given a major rewrite. He takes to the stage at The Opera House to talk about his new findings. 
In ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0’, Bill updates the book with the latest scientific research on the Earth and the universe. In the live show, you’ll hear about planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, and evolution. Throughout his career, the journalist and author has covered a wide range of subjects, including travel, the English language, and the human body. This rare chance to see him live promises forays into many of these areas. All conducted with his usual theatrical flair. 
Bill Bryson has a quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation and what humans are today. Join him as he shares the latest major advances in science.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Bubble Spectacular, Get ready for a different sort of pop sensation. Enter the effervescent world of The Bubble Spectacular. Take warm water, liquid soap, glycerin, and the creative talents of Dr Hubble. With those simple ingredients, Dr Hubble conjures up a fun-filled bubbly world. Prepare to be amazed as the ultimate master of bubbles creates an amazing bubble world. There’ll be little bubbles, big bubbles, volcanic bubbles, tornado bubbles, square bubbles, and with a bit of bubbly-magic, you might even end up inside a bubble. 
Young and old will enjoy a bubble party filled with laughter, audience participation and even a little burst of fire. As bubbles fly around the auditorium, get ready to pop, bounce, and boogie in an unbubb-levably fun way. Catch it before it floats away.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Dictionary of Moments, Directed By Jason Geary

This isn’t your ordinary dictionary.

Here, you won’t find dry definitions — instead, every word unlocks a moment from a story that brings its meaning to life.

Drawing from his acclaimed short story podcast of the same name, Jason Geary reinvents storytelling onstage with this bold hybrid of live-written tales and spontaneous scenes. Each performance is a one-of-a-kind experience where language leaps off the page and into vivid, unscripted life.

Part literary experiment, part theatrical adventure — words have never been this alive.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, Whakatau mai ki tētahi pō whakataetae whakaari i te rerehua, ā-kākahu hoki e whakanui ana i te hunga takatāpui, hunga whakawāhine hoki, me te rerehua o te toi Ballroom.
Experience a night of performances, beauty, and fashion as walkers compete for trophies in a display of queer and trans joy, liberation, and Ballroom artistry.
Full events programme: https://tepapa.nz/MaramaBall
The Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama present The Grand Kiki House Of Marama Ball.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom* scene.
With a fabulous line-up of categories, judges, commentators, and a DJ, including major local and international Ballroom figures, we invite you to wear your best outfits and prepare to finger snap, dance, and cheer the night away.
CATEGORIES AND THEMES:
Virgin Vogue – A Marama Storm (Treasure Chest)
Bizarre – Nocturnal Creatures of Folklore
Realness (Femme Queens, Trans Men, and Butch Queens) – Date Night Under the Moonlight
Hands Performance – Memoirs from Mother Marama
Body (Slim, Thicc and Luscious) – Heavenly Bodies
Butch Queen Vogue Fem – A Marama Storm (Pirates)
Face (Female Figures, Male Figures, and Gender Non-Conforming) – Beauty of the Blood Moon
OTA (Open to All) Best Dressed – Once in a Blue Moon
Commentator vs. Commentator – Echoes of the Moon
Femme Queen Performance – A Marama Storm (Mermaids)
OTA Runway – The Phases of Marama
House of the Night
JUDGES:
Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the House of Miyake-Mugler)
Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman
Trailblazing Founding Mother Ella Alexander
Legendary Founding Father Tamatoa Aitu
Founding Fatheir Fang Coven-Aucoin
COMMENTATORS:
Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Orijah Marama
DJ:
ATARANGI
BALLROOM COMMUNITY WALKERS & SPECTATORS TICKET ACCESS:
Contact the House of Marama on Instagram @houseofmarama or your local Ballroom leaders for the access codes to Ballroom Community Spectators & Walkers tickets.
There is a discount code that provides FREE access for Femme Queens who are not walking or competing. Contact us or your local leaders for the discount code.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball is hosted by the Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama and proudly supported by OVĀ Collective and Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.
This event is for adults only.
*BALLROOM
Ballroom is a subculture created in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Forged by Black and Latinx trans women and queer communities, it began as a protest against the racism they faced from White counterparts within the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as the transphobia and queerphobia they faced from mainstream society.
It is a space held to protect trans women of colour. Therefore, guests and participants of this culture alike must uphold respect and honour for this sacred space and those from which it came from. Homophobia, transphobia, or any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
Learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom on Google Arts and Culture.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.

It will be an evening of resonance and revelations with Imon Starr at the helm as MC. Look forward to a night to remember!

description:
The Lock of the C*ck Rings - A Comedy Show, Two fools. One cock ring. Zero clue.

From the warped minds of Garbage City (aka comedians Mo and Joel) comes an unhinged, experimental comedy odyssey through a realm of fantasy, filth, and foolishness.

Armed with nothing but wit, wigs, and questionable props, our heroes set out on a perilous quest to uncover the true purpose of the mysterious One Cock Ring. Along the way, they’ll face dark forces, ancient secrets, and an unexpected enemy.

Will they survive the journey?

One show to rule them all. Probably.

description:
The Monster in the Maze, The myth of the Minotaur is a tale almost as old as storytelling itself, but with The Monster in the Maze Jonathan Dove and Alisdair Middleton have excavated rich, new life from this classic. In this brand new staging by director Anapela Polataivao (Red White and Brass, Wild Dogs Under My Skirt), this story will be told as never before.

When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he metes out his punishment in the cruellest way possible: by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth, to be fed to the terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze: the Minotaur. As King Minos triumphs, his great monster “will eat your future, it will rip your hope, it will stamp your youth, your children in the sand.”

As the vindictive king will soon learn, however, these youth will not accept their fate without a fierce challenge. The Monster in the Maze is a story about resistance; about justice; about finding power not in oppression, but in collectivism. Fittingly, then, it’s also a groundbreaking work in its form: a community-focused and community-driven opera in which young and community singers and players stand proudly shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts, and in which both are integral.

The Monster in the Maze has been roundly praised by audiences, participants and reviewers worldwide, and in its Aotearoa debut season, it will serve as a gorgeous articulation of New Zealand Opera’s reciprocal community kaupapa.

Sung in English with surtitles.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
There Once Was a Boy..., Written and performed by Robert Lloyd

A boy is stranded at sea. A storm bears down on him, and, in what he believes are his final moments, he ponders his life and the choice he made to come here—to explore what’s over the curious horizon—and wonders: Was this a mistake? There once was a boy… is a fun, poetic performance for tweens, teens and their whānau. This live “pop-up book” explores curiosity, courage, and finding light in the darkness.

Recommended for audiences aged 10+. Contains flashing lights.

This show was created as part of the TAHI Festival 2025 Creative Residency programme, in partnership with Creative NZ, PAYPA and Toi Poneke Arts Centre.

description:
WELLINGTON, NZ - Coal Miners Daughter - 7.30pm, WELLINGTON, NZ - Coal Miners Daughter - 7.30pm
Coal Miner’s Daughter celebrates the incredible life of the late great Loretta Lynn.

Amber Joy Poulton (Loretta Lynn), Lizzie Moore (Patsy Cline) and The Preacher Denis Surmon (Conway Twitty & Willie Nelson), along with kickin' band The Holy Men, will sing the story of and celebrate Loretta Lynn. In floor length gowns adorned with tassels and rhinestones, with hair as close to country music heaven as possible, where country music started and still should be, in the theatre, just like the Grand Ole Opry, and it's coming to New Zealand!

This inspiring show was a smash hit at the 2025 Tamworth Country Music Festival and has played to packed theatres across Australia since its debut in 2017, but it's New Zealand that has been screaming out for a tour and the cast couldn't be more excited for their first New Zealand tour in October 2025. They will have you tappin' your toes, tilting your head and falling in love with country music all over again with hits like 'Coal Miner's Daughter', 'You Ain't Woman Enough To Take My Man', 'Crazy', 'You're Lookin' At Country', 'Walkin' After Midnight', 'One's On The Way', 'Stand By Your Man', 'Faded Love' and more.

This is a show not to be missed!

"Loretta Lynn paved the way for women like me in country music to take centre stage" - Amber Joy Poulton star of Coal Miner's Daughter

Wairarapa Word - Fiction x 2, Authors Anna Smaill and Carl Shuker, who are wife and husband, will talk about their life as writers, read from their books, and sign copies of their books.
ANNA SMAILL is the author of The Chimes, which was longlisted for the Man Booker Prize, The Violinist in Spring and most recently, Bird Life.
CARL SHUKER is the author of several novels, most recently A Mistake which has been adapted for film, and The Royal Free.

They will be in conversation with PHILIPPA TUCKER, writer, copy editor with takahē magazine, deputy editor with Shepherdess magazine, and Wairarapa Word committee member.

Nau mai haere mai. Koha. All welcome. No reservations required.
Note the venue is located beside Carterton Library & Wairarapa Events Centre
Almo's Books is the bookseller.

WAIRARAPA WORD is a free monthly writers' series since 2012.
The volunteer group receives support from Almo's Books, Wairarapa Events Centre, and Wairarapa Library Service.

description:
Wellington Law Revue 2025 - Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes), With the local elections looming, the Wellington City Council is divided. The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money.

Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...

The Monopoly Man!

Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes) presented by Peaches and Cream.

Please be advised that this production includes short sequences of flashing lights.

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
World Press Photo Exhibition 2025, Gathered from across the globe, step into stories that matter. The World Press Photo Exhibition 2025 brings compelling images captured by photojournalists and documentary photographers around the world. They capture powerful moments from world events that help people better understand issues of today. You’ll see stories of migration, climate change, war, protest, family, animals, sport, and more. 
This year’s World Press Photo competition attracted 59,320 entries from 3,778 photographers across 141 countries. A global jury chose 42 winners across six regions and three categories. These stunning images can be seen at the Tākina exhibition centre in Wellington from 5 September to 5 October.

description:
‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW
‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email for more information and group bookings
label: Arts & Theatre

description: ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email sez@toimatarua.co.nz for more information and group bookings
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future, Marlborough Tech Community Morning Tea: Shaping Our Future
Marlborough’s tech community has big potential and it’s time to shape the next chapter together.

Event details
� Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
� Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm�
Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.

Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and help set the direction for our region’s tech future.

We’ll be talking about:Making coworking more accessible for sole contractors, early-stage founders, and startups. Creating regular opportunities for local students to get hands-on support from industry experts. Forming a Marlborough Tech Steering Group to guide our community and develop a Tech Community Charter.

Whether you’re building a startup, freelancing in tech, developing software, designing hardware, or exploring emerging technologies your voice matters.
This is an open, inclusive kōrero. Come along, share your ideas, and help create a connected, collaborative tech community in Marlborough.

description:
The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 13th & 14th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation

Info about the teacher:
Guinean percussionist Sibo Bangoura grew up in Matam – the heart of Conakry’s arts precinct – surrounded by a family of griots. His mother was a singer and his father abalafon player. Sibo absorbed the rhythm from his infancy and began to study percussion formally at the age of 12. At 14, he joined Boka Junior ensemble and then played with Ballet Matam for many years, until he moved to Australia.
Sibo currently resides in Sydney and travels to China, Japan, Singapore and Thailand to teach and perform. He plays with his brothers Mohamed and Epizo Bangoura and has a successful 8-piece band Keyim Ba
If you have ANY questions please feel free to get in touch with Bridget xo
To book your space:
Please put your NAME & which session you are doing ie: ‘OPEN DANCE’ as a reference & pay into account
Bridget Kelly ANZ 010797054191130

Thank you for supporting this event

description:
123 of Oil Painting, This course is structured around a series of oil painting exercises that explore the foundations of still-life, portrait and landscape painting. For Beginners through to Intermediate, Melissa will teach the basics of oil painting techniques, colour mixing, skin tones, equipment choices for painting.

With an emphasis on simple beginnings, the lessons will include

- colour theory
- skin tones, structure and composition
- copying master paintings in order to improve observational skills while learning the components of structure and composition

Melissa provides images to learn from, and students can also bring their own A4 images

Class is suitable for all levels of experience; we start from where you are. Melissa focuses on a personalised approach for the student with an emphasis on finding that person’s passion in art.

All basic materials provided

Thursdays, 16 October - 4 December, 11 am - 2 pm.

description:
2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA, 2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA
Want to learn the exact martial art skills as used in the Bourne films? Wellington this is your chance...

Tactical Survival Academy is hosting Senior Instructor Stephen Brown from the renowned Inosanto Academy of Martial Arts in Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles!

With over 40 years of martial arts experience and 36 years training under Guro Dan Inosanto, Stephen is one of only two instructors currently teaching Kali classes at the academy alongside Guro Dan Inosanto himself.

Stephen specializes in the Filipino Martial Art of Kali, as passed down through Guro Inosanto’s lineage. His training background also includes extensive experience in Muay Thai, Silat, Western Boxing, Jeet Kune Do, Savate and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

Over the decades, Stephen has worked with:
* Multiple branches of Law Enforcement, Military units and Special Forces.
* Actors, stunt performers, and executives in the film and television industry.
* As a fight choreographer for screen productions.

Known for his precision, adaptability, and deep respect for the cultural roots of the arts he teaches, Stephen brings a wealth of knowledge and embodied experience to every seminar.

Currently based in Marina Del Rey, CA, Stephen is excited to share the Kali method of Guro Inosanto with the New Zealand martial arts community.

• Location: Mt Cook School Hall, 160 Tory Street, Te Aro
• Dates: Sat Sept 6 + Sun Sept 7
• Time: 1:30pm – 4:30pm (both days)
• Cost: One Day Only (Sat or Sun) $140 / Both Days $260
• Registration Closing Date: Wed Sept 3rd

Bookings Email:
More info: www.tacticalsurvival.co.nz/kali

Sibo absorbed the rhythm from his infancy and began to study percussion formally at the age of 12. At 14, he joined Boka Junior ensemble and then played with Ballet Matam for many years, until he moved to Australia.
Sibo currently resides in Sydney and travels to China, Japan, Singapore and Thailand to teach and perform. He plays with his brothers Mohamed and Epizo Bangoura and has a successful 8-piece band Keyim Ba

description:
Anyone Can Draw - Observational, Learn to create a realistic drawing from what you see. This introductory class teaches the technical skills of observational drawing using a variety of media, including pen and ink, charcoal, pencil and pastel.

Students will learn a range of formal skills through exercises in the following:

- Quality of line
- Accurate observation of shape
- Gesture drawing
- Use of negative and positive shapes
- Using tone well
- Direct observation of spaces such as interiors, buildings or landscapes

With expert guidance from Denise you will learn a broad range of skills that can serve as a basis for advancing into classes in painting and assist and finding your own means of expression.

All materials provided.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Anyone Can Draw - Structural, In this course you will examine structural drawing with a careful helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids. Both these structural approaches contribute greatly to the success of your drawing.

Geometric shapes can simplify a subject, unify a drawing and make compositions dynamic. Geometric solids will help render any subject in three dimensions and transition to perspective.

A good working knowledge of the concepts of perspective will help you draw any subject with correct dimensionality. It can also help in your realist drawing, painting and invented subjects and environments. These concepts are also used in most two dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.

8 x weekly morning or afternoon sessions. All basic materials supplied.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshops, To celebrate WOW (World of Wearable Art) season here in Wellington, we're offering two beautiful aromatherapy candle-making workshops, to be held at Wellington Apothecary. These will be held in the afternoon so you can do something fun before the show or before dinner during your stay here in Wellington.

What to expect?
Discover the natural beauty of therapeutic essential oils, learn about scent layering, design your own signature scent and make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle.

When? Friday 19 September, 3pm to 5pm and Friday 3 October, 4pm to 6pm
Where? Wellington Apothecary, Cuba Mall, Wellington

____

What's included in the workshop...

Be guided by Melanie of Poet Botanicals and discover the natural beauty of over 40 pure essential oils
Learn about scent layering and how to create your own essential oil blends at home
Step-by-step guidance on how to make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle
Locally produced refreshments

Investment per person ~ $125. Bookings essential. Suitable for ages 14 years and over. Not recommended if you're pregnant due to the nature of some essential oils.

Please note that your candle will need to cure overnight and will be available for either pickup from Wellington Apothecary or we can courier it to you (cost of courier included in workshop fee). Thank you.

____

Cancellation policy
If you can no longer attend the workshop please contact us at least 72 hours prior for a full refund. If you cancel within 72 hours we can only provide a refund or move you to another date, if we're able to rebook your spot. Thank you.

You’ll be guided through the basics of photographing stars, planets, and deep-sky wonders — from camera settings and lenses to composition and editing. If you have a DSLR or mirrorless camera, bring it along for practical tips; if not, come to be inspired and learn how astrophotographers transform the dark Wairarapa skies into works of art.

Audience:

Amateur and aspiring astrophotographers
Stargazers who want to try a new skill
Anyone curious about night sky photography

description:
Balfolk Class - Newtown, Balfolk is a folk dance and music movement from Europe that gives new life to traditional dances. A ‘Bal Folk’ is a social dance event that brings people of all ages and walks of life together through group and partner dances to have fun and connect. It's a friendly, social and energising space.
The class will run over 6 weeks. We will learn and practice different group and partner dances you would commonly find in a Bal Folk.
Dances are simple and easy to learn but also have depth so once you have learnt the basics, we can explore and play around with variations.
Balfolk is accessible to people with all skill levels. You don’t need any previous dance experience, curiosity is all you need

This workshop is more general than some of our other more topic specific sessions. We will cover:

description:
Botanical Blues - Photographic cyanotype, Explore the historic photographic process of the cyanotype and create luminous blueprints of leaves and flowers.

In this workshop, you’ll discover the beautiful 19th-century photographic process of the cyanotype (often called a blueprint), known for its striking Prussian blue tones. In its earliest form, the cyanotype was used to record botanical specimens. During our workshop, you’ll collect plants or foliage from the garden (or bring your own) to create delicate contact prints on watercolour paper. We’ll coat paper with light-sensitive chemistry, expose your designs in the sunlight, and develop and tone your prints with tea (!) to add depth and variation to your series of finished images.

All materials included.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block C, Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico + elastico push
Week 2: lateral
Week 3: elástico upright (lead walking around)
Week 4: abertura e giro
Week 5:Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.

description:
Bulgarian Folk Dance Class, Join Bulgarian Ensemble Horo and Discover the Joy of Bulgarian Folk Dance!
No partner? No problem! Our dances are performed in open circles, so everyone is welcome.
Come and experience the vibrant rhythms and rich traditions of Bulgarian music and dance!
Our group regularly performs at multicultural festivals and Bulgarian cultural events around Wellington.
About Our Teacher – Lilia Petrova de Castro:
Lilia began dancing Bulgarian folk at just 8 years old. With 15 years of experience performing across Bulgaria and Europe with Dance Ensemble "Svetlina" and the renowned folk ensemble "Sredetz", she brings deep knowledge and passion to every class. Lilia believes dancing is one of the best ways to energize your body and uplift your mind and she loves sharing that joy with others!

Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!

description:
Chain Maille Course, Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:
Week 01 - 18th September
101: Basic Skills and Discovery
At this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.
Opening & closing rings properly
Trying out some simple structures
Begin exploring material options and how to make your own rings
Homework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th September
Play and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projects
Playing with recycled & foraged materials
Homework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd October
Mathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.
Math of designing chain maille
Theory & pre-planning
Discussion about ideas for individual projects
Identify materials needed to execute individual designs
Homework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th October
By this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th October
These classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th November
At this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.

description:
Chess – Learn to Play, Chess is an ancient game of strategy and analysis that hones concentration and focus, as you master the skills allowing you to win at this competitive recreation.
Join tutor, Ryan Hill to learn how to play this game from the beginning.
You will quickly go from understanding the basics to being able to engage in playing confidently and discover where to go for further training or to carry on playing – both in person and online.
Over 600 million people play this game that has remained popular throughout the ages – why don’t you become one of them!
Bring pen and paper to take notes.
By the end of this course you will be able to:
*Be able to use all of the chess pieces to play the game
*Be able to recount and use some of the most common openings and traps
*Recognise where to go for further training or to play
*Develop increasing levels of confidence in your ability to play and possibly win
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Child First Aid Course, Child First Aid Course
*This course is now fully booked. Please enter your details if you would like to go on the waitlist. Ngā mihi*


This half-day course is ideal for people who are looking after children in their own home or for those needing to renew their Child First Aid certificate.


In this course, in-depth lessons and scenario-based activities will give you:
- the skills to identify and deal with serious illness and life-threatening medical emergencies
- the confidence to be able to offer vital assistance before more experienced help arrives
- a Child First Aid certificate valid for 2 years upon successful completion.

Training provided by Hato Hone St John. This course has been generously funded by the St John Area Committee for the Wairarapa.

Please register your interest in attending by filling out this form: https://form.jotform.com/252087575168871.

Spaces are strictly limited. A waitlist will be in place once we reach capacity.

description:
Childrens “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland, Childrens “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland
DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 2-3pm
LOCATION: Greytown Art Gallery
AGES: 8-12 years
COST: $35 (all materials provided)

Children’s “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland – 60 minutes of fun and focused creativity for children aged 8 – 12 years. Immerse your child in a world of colour and creativity with the Under the Sea collage workshop, led by experienced educator Linda Kirkland. Drawing inspiration from the bold, large-scale collages of Henri Matisse—who famously described his technique as painting with scissors—Linda will guide the children through an exciting exploration of shape, colour, and composition. Her engaging teaching style will inspire the young artists to create vibrant and unique masterpieces that bring the underwater world to life.

This workshop has limited space.
Please register here: https://greytownarttown.com/childrens-matisse-collage-workshop-with-linda-kirkland/

description:
Clay Creations: Incense Holders, Clay Creations: Incense Holders

Settle in for a cosy evening of creativity, good company, and delicious food.
In this hands-on workshop, everyone will be guided step-by-step to make their own incense holder from air-dry clay — no pottery wheel or kiln needed. The design inspiration for the night will be a dreamy moon-and-stars theme, but there’s plenty of room for personal flair. Those who love to freestyle can create their own unique style, while those who prefer a little direction can simply follow along and enjoy the process.

It’s an easy-going, beginner-friendly space where conversations flow, laughter is encouraged, and there’s something grounding about feeling clay in your hands. It’s a chance to step away from the usual routine, relax into a slower pace, and take joy in making something from scratch.

After the crafting is done, the evening continues with a beautiful plant-based dinner and dessert shared together — wholesome food to round out a wholesome night. Everyone will head home with their own handmade incense holder, a full belly, and that cozy, satisfied feeling that comes from a night spent creating and connecting.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Clean and Care: Green Cleaning Workshop, Ready to clean your home without harsh chemicals - and without falling for “green” marketing that isn’t so green?
Join eco-lifestylist Stella Carruthers for a fun, hands-on workshop where you’ll discover how to take control of what’s in your cleaning products and why that matters for your health, your wallet, and the planet.
What you’ll learn:
- How to spot real eco-friendly products (and avoid greenwashing)
- Simple, natural ingredients you can use from your own kitchen
- How to make effective, affordable cleaning solutions that actually work
During the workshop, you’ll help make a variety of natural cleaning products - and take home samples to try for yourself.
Please bring: 2 small bottles and 1 container (upcycled items like hummus tubs or soda bottles work perfectly!)

description:
Cooking Classes, Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Cooking: Masalas & Breads From India, Masala is the Indian word for curry. Spend the day making a range of curries both from scratch and by adapting spice packets, for family meals and special occasions. All ingredients provided.

Take a day and create a range of delicious and different Indian masalas, using both Manjula’s tried-and-true recipes but also some of the new spice mixes now available in Indian shops. You’ll also learn how to make a variety of breads (naan, roti and parathas) to serve with the curries.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
- Create several different masalas (curries)
- Make tasty Indian bread accompaniments
- Adapt ready-made spice mixes to enhance the flavours
- Use a range a different Indian spices with more confidence

All ingredients provided but bring an apron, dishcloth, tea towels and containers to take any leftovers home.

Presented by Manjula Patel.

description: Create Your Own Coffee Blend, Join Mojo's team of coffee experts for this hands-on specialty coffee tasting and blending workshop at their iconic roastery on Wellington's waterfront. Experts will showcase the world's flavours through single-origin coffees and help you create your own custom blend to take home. Learn about the farmers Mojo work with, different coffee growing regions and why each coffee is so unique. Hosted by Mojo's highly experienced coffee specialists, their head roaster will also give you an up-close demonstration of the roasting process and explain what it takes to make the perfect blend. Drinks and nibbles provided.

During this magic-filled workshop you'll:

description:
Dance with Janni, Conscious dance is part free form dance and part relaxation. It promotes creative self-expression, has some great health benefits and is for everyone to enjoy.
This is a safe and inclusive space to move and dance while having the opportunity to relax, stretch and be your true self.
There are no steps to learn, instead there will be minimal guidance to help you during the session.
Bring water, a small blanket, socks or dance barefoot and wear comfy clothes move in, even if that includes sparkles.
This initiative has the support of Creative Communities NZ.
Koha entry - pay what you feel is fair for our time together.

It is expected that you will have completed a complete Improvers course (30 weeks) before you join the deep dive classes.

description:
Draw it Out - Re-finding Your Spark, Guided drawings to re-find your spark and what it is that's driving you.

Join us for a DRAW IT OUT drawing for wellness workshop. Practice the ‘art’ of drawing and writing for wellness. This 1.5 hour workshop takes you through guided cues (similar to meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at, draw out how you are feeling, and draw out your own inner guidance.

We all have the resources within to guide us, this workshop creates the space to access this by using a modality called Interactive Drawing Therapy. Facilitated by Lara Phillips, this is not therapy rather drawing for wellness; a guided workshop to build one’s relationship with oneself, to strengthen self-reflection and self-care.

No drawing skills required, this is more mark making not art making. Materials supplied.

description:
Drypoint Printmaking Workshop, Explore drypoint printmaking with experienced local print maker Kirsty White.

In this workshop you will

- Learn to etch a polycarbonate plate
- Use steel needle point tools and wire brushes to create line and texture that will hold ink.
- learn to ink up your plate
- use mull cloth to achieve desired tone
- print on damp printmaking paper
- run this print through a second stage using the relief process of inking up and printing from a natural textured block
- Learn more about your tutor here.

All materials supplied.
Half hour lunch break -bring a packed lunch to eat in the historic Inverlochy House or explore the local Te Aro cafes.

description:
Expressive Watercolour, Watercolour is special because of the fluid properties that produce spontaneous and unique results. The inability to anticipate exactly what the paint will do makes watercolour an exciting medium to work with.

In this course we will learn to set the conditions for surprising and beautiful accidents to occur on the page. By incorporating these looser abstract elements into representational paintings we can convey heightened emotions in our work.

Throughout the term we will cover the following:

- The wet into wet technique to achieve one of a kind paint interactions.
- Learn about transparent colour mixing to create luminosity in your paintings.
- Use marbling to find organic shapes and patterns.
- Study the relationship between line and colour and the different
- Ways they can be combined to find a personal style.
- Experiment with composition through collage.

Each class we will look at examples of historic and contemporary painting, and discuss how to selectively incorporate references into your work. Over the term you will build up a visual style and body of work.

Whether you’re new to watercolour or looking to expand your range, this course offers an opportunity to explore the expressive potential of watercolour.

Basic materials included. Students must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
Fairy Potion Garden: An Enchanted Workshop, Fairy Potion Garden: An Enchanted Workshop (1.5 hours)

Step into the enchanted fairy grove for a magical potion-making adventure! Led by a whimsical fairy guide, this hands-on workshop invites young potion crafters (ages 5+) to mix glittery brews, stir up flowery scents, and create their own take-home fairy potions.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Family Watercolour Art Class - Grey Day at Petone Wharf, In this class all the family can share 2 hours of creative fun together and grown ups can join in for youth price of $25. All materials supplied including quality watercolour paper, just arrive empty handed and two hours they will have a completed painting. No previous art experience is required as these workshops are suitable for both beginners and artists who’d like to fine tune their skills and style a little further. Don’t worry about drawing as this will be done so we can focus on the joys of watercolour painting. A step-by step teaching style is used and this all happens in a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable classroom overlooking the harbour.

Check out other classes, each has a different subject to choose from, Also available are Saturday family art classes as well as Wine & Watercolour evenings on Friday and Saturday evenings.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: Floral Therapy - A Wild Bouquet Workshop, Join us for a hands-on floral workshop where nature, creativity, and intentional design come together. Led by Jade — a floral designer with a background in natural health — you’ll learn how to create a garden-style hand-tied bouquet using seasonal blooms and healing herbs. We’ll explore bouquet-building techniques, flower symbolism, and how to work with nature’s rhythms in your design process. No prior experience needed — just bring your curiosity and love for flowers.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Fly Fishing, An introduction to fly fishing for trout, with three sessions at the High School, one at the Capital Trout Centre and a choice of two river visits.

An introduction to fly fishing for trout, which includes choosing gear, finding the fish, fly tying and casting and a practical fishing session.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Apply the basics of fly fishing
- Choose the appropriate tackle
- Have an appreciation of the entomology associated with trout
- Demonstrate practical aspects of casting, knot tying, tying of flies and stream craft
- Present an appropriate fly to the water with a reasonable chance of catching a trout

There are three sessions at the high school, plus a session at the Capital Trout Centre and a choice of two river sessions (times and dates to be discussed at the class).

Tutors from Wellington Flyfishers Club. There may also be additional opportunity before class (from 6pm) for casting practice before sessions 2 and 3.

(This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk.)

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

5 sessions (3 at WHS on Thu 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM and 2 river visits at times to be confirmed)
Presented by Strato Cotsilinis
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Foxton | Food Lovers Masterclass, Foxton | Food Lovers Masterclass
Come along and learn about why we waste food and how to stop it. There will be a few face-palm moments and lots of laughs as Kate takes you through the reasons we waste food and what we can do about it.

This is a fun but informative session and you will leave inspired with a cool goodie bag full of samples to get you started.

VIP Ticket price - $10, get a goodie bag worth $40
FREE Ticket - No Goodie Bag included
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Free Fun CPR Training, We have just installed an AED on our building. We hope this will save lives!
We would therefore love to invite you to come and learn the basics to helping save lives for free.
This event is a fun, interactive session that gives you the basic skills that could help save a life in the event of a sudden cardiac arrest. You will learn everything you need to know in less than 90 minutes. This includes:
- What to do in an emergency
- How to recognise someone in cardiac arrest and how to perform CPR
- Where to find an AED and how to use it
- About the GoodSAM Responder App.
Knowing CPR means you could save the life of a friend, a colleague, a member of your whānau, or someone on the street.
Reserve your place by emailing vicar@peninsulaparish.nz.

description:
Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau, Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau
📌 Registration Required – Limited spaces available! Sign up to secure your spot.

Proudly partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau

🍽️ Free Cooking Class – Bring Your Own Containers
This is a free, hands-on cooking experience, and we encourage participants to bring their own takeaway containers to share the food with their whānau.

💛 Koha Appreciated
While the class is free, a koha (donation) towards ingredients is appreciated to help support the program.

👩‍🍳 This Session’s Menu:

• Fried Fish with Tomato Sauce (Cá chiên sốt cà) – Crispy fried fish coated in a rich, tangy tomato sauce, balancing savoury and slightly sweet flavours.

• Cabbage Soup (Canh bắp cải) – A light and comforting soup made with tender cabbage, simmered in a delicate broth for a refreshing taste.

• Egg Salad (Salad trứng) – A simple yet nutritious salad featuring boiled eggs, fresh vegetables, and a light dressing for a refreshing side dish.

Join us for a fun, hands-on experience and bring home healthy, delicious Vietnamese meals! 🥢🍲✨

description:
French - Introductory 2, For those who have done Introductory 1 (16 hours) or have equivalent knowledge (e.g. who may have picked up some basic survival language through travel).

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Use basic French in a variety of everyday situations with some confidence (e.g. holidays, travel, at home)
- Use the present, the imperative and the near future tenses of regular and some common irregular verbs, in both the affirmative and negative forms
- Use prepositions with names of countries, cities and places
- Name and locate places in town, including shops
- Ask and give directions and ask and understand the time


8 weeks, Tue 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Juliana Stroghiu
$199 incl. GST

description:
Fresh Summer Rolls – Healthy Cooking Workshop (FREE), These free classes are made possible thanks to Pomare Taita Community House & E Tū Whānau
Roll into Flavour with Us!
Light, fresh, and packed with vibrant Vietnamese herbs – Gỏi Cuốn (Fresh Summer Rolls) are the perfect summer treat. Join us for a fun and hands-on class to learn how to make this iconic dish from scratch.
What You’ll Learn:
• Prepping and handling delicate rice paper
• Rolling techniques that hold up!
• How to layer herbs, protein, and veggies for balance and flavour
• Making your own traditional dipping sauce
Facilitator: Yung Nguyen – a passionate home cook and cultural storyteller from Viet Hub NZ who loves sharing recipes that connect people across cultures.
Perfect for:
Foodies & beginners alike
Families, students, and community members
Anyone curious about Vietnamese culture or healthy cooking!
⸻
Come roll, dip, and taste the magic of Vietnamese cuisine in a welcoming and relaxed setting.
Remember: Registrations open one week before the event. First come, first served!
#VietHubNZ #FreshSummerRolls #VietnameseCookingClass #GoiCuon #CommunityKitchen #FreeWorkshop #YungNguyen #TasteOfVietnam
Proudly partnered with Pomare Taita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau

Gardening bee, Come and learn about weeding, making compost! Join experienced gardeners as we look after our beautiful community garden. Free for all.
This gardening bee will be hosted by Alison.
Hopefully the weather will be kind for this coming Sunday.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Giant Crepe Flower Workshop, This hands-on class covers everything from selecting the finest crepé paper to mastering intricate petal techniques. Discover the joy of transforming simple materials into stunning, oversized blooms that make perfect décor. With no prior experience needed, you'll leave with a beautiful creation and the skills to make more.

Perfect for beginners, our workshop will guide you through the process of turning crepe paper into lush, realistic flowers. Each petal is hand-cut, curved, and assembled with care—but don’t worry, I’ll share all my tips and tricks to make it feel simple and fun! Choose from a gorgeous palette of colours and I’ll prep your materials in advance, so all you need to do is show up and enjoy.

Take a look at the colour options and choose your favourite! I’ll prepare your paper in advance for the workshop.

DATES
Saturday 11th October | 10am-1230pm
Saturday 11th October | 2-430pm
$90pp
ALL MATERIALS PROVIDED

-Bookings close 19th September-

Our workshops will take place in a store just off the food court!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Glass Bead-Making Taster, Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Glass Jewellery-making - 4-week Block, Join us for this fabulous block of classes in glass jewellery-making! The course starts on Thursday 11 September and runs for 4 weeks until Thursday 2 October, 5.30pm - 8.30pm.

This course is a great way for beginners and those with some experience to get into working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways.

Students will learn correct tool use and gain a solid understanding of the lampwork process. They will also learn some ways of incorporating their beads into wearable jewellery with silver and/or stainless-steel findings

Course cost includes set materials, such as glass and stainless-steel findings. Silver, findings and extra glass are available to purchase in the studio.

People under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Glass Jewellery-making - 4-week Block, Join us for this fabulous block of classes in glass jewellery-making! The course starts on Thursday 2 October and runs for 4 weeks until Thursday 23 October, 5.30pm - 8.30pm.

description:
Guitar - Beginners, Learn the basic chords, strumming and lots of songs.
Bring your acoustic guitar.

By the end of the course, you'll have learned how to play simple guitar tunes, using easy tricks the professionals use. You'll be able to:
- Demonstrate a number of basic chords
- Demonstrate a range of basic strumming patterns
- Play a range of simple songs confidently - Demonstrate how to tune a guitar
- Demonstrate how to use a capo
Bring your own acoustic guitar.

Wellington High School
Presented by Will Allardice
$125.00 incl. GST
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Guitar - Next Step, Follow on from the beginners' course and learn barre chords, more complex strumming styles and simple finger picking.

Bring your own acoustic guitar.

By the end of the course, you'll have built on the skills learned in the Beginners’ course and will be able to:
- Play additional chords, including E and Am shape barre chords
- Demonstrate new strumming patterns
- Demonstrate basic fingerpicking techniques
- Confidently play more songs which use the chords and strums learned
- Build up the F chord to 5 strings
- Move common chord shapes up the fretboard

Bring your own acoustic guitar.

8 weeks
Presented by Will Allardice.

Harvy's Tango class, Tango? Did someone say Argentine Tango in our neighborhood.
Yes, that's correct.
Wednesday night come along and have a go at Argentinas Famous Tango.

description:
Healing with Heels - Wellington, Te Auaha, Wellington
This isn’t just a heels class; it’s about reclaiming your desires, pleasures, and fantasies. Feel the freedom of moving your body, tapping into the sensuality and confidence that’s always been within you.
This experience fuses sultry Burlesque, fierce Commercial, and fluid Somatic movements, creating a space that’s free from judgment and full of self-expression. Whether you're a seasoned dancer or a first-timer, come let go, have fun, and feel the electric energy of stepping into your ultimate, unapologetic self.
See you there!

zoekeesueguidance.com
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Heels Technique & Tricks, Ever wondered how to strut your stuff in heels with confidence and flair?
The secret lies in mastering the technique! From flawless walks and captivating combos to strength-building exercises and perfect posture, it’s all about technique and practice.
Why is heel technique important?
- Safety First: Proper technique prevents injuries, ensuring you can dance for years to come.
- Strength & Posture: Build the muscles needed to support your ankles, knees, and back, while perfecting that elegant posture.
- Confidence Boost: Knowing you have the technique down pat gives you the confidence to own the floor!
Whether you’re a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class will cover:
- Walks that turn heads
- Seamless combos
- Targeted exercises for strength
- Posture tips to keep you looking and feeling your best
Bookings via zoekeesueguidance.com
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Heroes and Villains Sculpting Workshop, Calling all makers! Design and sculpt your own pocket-sized hero or cheeky villain in our hands-on workshop, inspired by The Bad Guys 2.

Using colourful plasticine and tinfoil, you’ll learn how simple shapes can turn into mischievous villains or loveable heroes – and take home your very own character masterpiece.

Everyone's favourite felons are back, and this time, they've got company. Buckle up for a non-stop action-comedy adventure! The Bad Guys 2 is in cinemas these school holidays.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Host Responsibility Training - Wellington 4th February 2026, Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Houghton Valley Community Hall Raranga, Houghton Valley Community Hall Raranga
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Houghton Valley Community Hall, warmly invites you to:

Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.

Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.

💚 Session Times
• Beginners: 11:00am – 1:00pm
• Returners: 1:00pm – 4:30pm (pack down starts at 4:00pm)

💚 What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors,
• an old towel (if you have one)
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke

• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Please take any leftover harakeke home with you

💚 Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at for koha details.

Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.

Contact
via facebook https://www.facebook.com/TMKhuihui
Email

If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email ) for the account details.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
IDEA Report Launch: Kids KiwiSaver, The Institute for Democratic and Economic Analysis (IDEA) invites you to the launch of a new and exciting proposal for a Kids KiwiSaver scheme.

Our latest report explores the potential benefits from enrolling all children in KiwiSaver and helping parents to contribute to the accounts. This could be an innovative way to address the growing concerns about New Zealand's lack of savings, and help deepen our capital markets and increase investment in domestic ventures.

At the launch, IDEA research director Max Rashbrooke will outline how Kids KiwiSaver could also be a vehicle for economic opportunity and security, creating a financial foundation for young people who might otherwise enter adulthood without any such support.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Improv For the Stage, Extend your skills in the joy and art of improvisation and step boldly onstage. This course is for those who have completed a beginner course or have other relevant experience.

Laugh, play characters, get them into trouble (and out again!), and see how your skills translate into confident performance.

This is the W.I.T. Level 2 course and will take your improv to the next step beyond the confidence-building of our Joy of Improv and on into collaborative spontaneous theatre creation.

The course is suitable for those who have completed a foundation course either with W.I.T. or another improv troupe or have some theatrical experience or training.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Create characters and stories in open scenes
