After the meal, one local artist of any discipline will present a performance, workshop, game, discussion, or some type of engagement with the community. Interested in contributing some type of artistic workshop or performance? Email us at artspotluck@gmail.com.

Note: Every first Wednesday of the month, we meet at an alternate location: Paekākāriki Memorial Hall, 98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034.

description:
Wellington Frocktails 2025, Wellington Frocktails, with our headline sponsor The Fabric Store, celebrates the making of garments. Whether you sew, knit, crochet or stitch, September 6th is the evening to show off your proudest make! Frocktails is a worldwide movement, celebrating me-mades for over 10 years.
Mingle with new sewing friends and say cheers over a shared passion of this craft. Whether you're an expert or beginner, this event is for you.
Included in the ticket price is a welcome cocktail (or non-alcoholic beverage), second beverage, light refreshments, a goodie bag and the chance to win one of the many sewing related prizes. A photographer will be on hand to capture the event and all of your wonderful me-mades! With exclusive use of the venue, the option to purchase other beverages will be available.
You will need to be 18+ to attend this event.

Please note: A photographer is present at this event. Photos taken may be used for marketing purposes in future event promotions

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

Wellington Lens Club Fortnightly Meetup, Wellington Lens Club Fortnightly Meetup
Calling on all photography enthusiasts! Join us this Friday for another fortnightly meetup with the Wellington Lens Club! We gather every second Friday at Heyday Beer Co (264a Cuba Street) 5:30-7pm - if we meet else where it will be announced on the event discussion and in the group. We'll kick off this weeks event with drinks and engaging conversations about camera lenses. Photo walk begins 7pm until 8:30pm, followed by a delicious dinner from 8:30-10pm. This FREE event is open to everyone, especially those interested in vintage lenses and adapting them to modern cameras. Don't miss out!

description:
Wellington Writers Walk walking tour, Walk the Walk – explore the iconic Wellington Writers Walk on a guided waterfront walking tour.

The much-loved Wellington Writers Walk consists of a series of 23 quotations from well-known New Zealand writers. This walking tour, led by members of the Writers Walk committee, will provide an opportunity to find out more about its history, discover some of the sculptures and ask questions.

This event is the perfect place to play games like Dungeons and Dragons for the first time, while enjoying a pint and some warm kai. Enjoy a pint and some warm kai while our professional storytellers guide you through an unforgettable tabletop roleplaying experience at The Welsh Dragon.

description:
Wow Train Vip Experience Ex Auckland: SOLD OUT, **SOLD OUT** - but limited tickets are still currently available for the Christchurch to Wellington WOW Train and Ferry Experience

Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing 2nd October, 2025

Beginning in Auckland or Hamilton, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the North Island aboard the Northern Explorer WOW Train. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, your journey ascends yet further with premium 'Gold' seats at the World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience through the volcanic heart of the North Island on your way to our stunning capital, Wellington. There, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Friday 3 October and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train journey aboard the Northern Explorer on 2 October (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!)
Onboard WOW entertainment and goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

From NZ$1995 per adult

description:
Wā Tākaro- games and kōrero, Wā Tākaro- games and kōrero
Come and play tabletop games and practice your te reo Māori at the Newlands Community Centre.

All levels have been participating - beginners and fluent speakers. So please feel comfortable to come along.

There are games suited to all levels, and info sheets to help beginners. Playing games is a fantastic way to pick up new kupu and phrases and use what you have already learned.

Kēmu include: Kaupapa, Tākaro!, Kāri Māori, Wero, Whare Whare, Kupu Rorirori, Ko Wai Koe? and any others you bring along.

A free activity with supper provided. Parking available right outside.

description:
Zombie Horde Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025, Zombie Horde Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025
The undead rise in Wellington! Join the Zombie Horde Pub Crawl on Nov. 1 for 4+ pubs, specials, & a monstrous finale!

About this Event


Zombie Horde: Halloween Pub Crawl – Wellington 2025 🧟‍♂️

On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, the undead rise in Wellington. The Zombie Horde Pub Crawl takes you through 4+ pubs and bars, each with their own specials and Halloween themes. Walk with the horde, grab exclusive drinks, and end the night at the ultimate zombie party.




What’s Included
Admission to multiple participating pubs
Crawl wristband for entry & specials
No cover charge at participating venues
Digital crawl map for navigation
DJs and live entertainment at select stops


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the opening pub.
🍺 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Gather at the last venue for the closing zombie party.



Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices increase closer to Halloween.
🧛 Costumes encouraged — whether you’re a fresh zombie, survivor, or something in between, you’ll fit right in.
📍 Venue lineup announced soon. Full details will be available on the Digital Crawl Map on event day.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
october meet-up ★ imaging moments of wonder!, We have been working on a beautiful new project with our friends at Splendid Photo, called potluck slideshow. Leading up to the event on Saturday 8th November, we are using our monthly meet-ups to inspire you to work towards the brief moments of wonder.
So in the spirit of noticing the wonder around us, we will be taking a walk from Innermost Gardens in Mount Victoria, through the bush and city, to the sea. Bring a camera, and let's make some photographs together!
As always, anyway is welcome, no matter who you are, or your experience level. We would love to see you there!

The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. description:
Creepy Cute Market, The Creepy Cute Market Returns to Wellington!
Get ready, Wellington! The Creepy Cute Market is coming back to town!
When: Saturday, 30 August 2025, 9:30am – 2:30pm
Where: Thistle Hall, Upper Cuba Street, Wellington
Indulge your love for the weird, whimsical, and wonderfully wicked at a market where spooky meets sweet. After a hauntingly successful run last time, we're thrilled to return with even more delightfully dark treasures for all you macabre-loving misfits.
Expect:
Spine-tingling art & prints
Spooktacular fashion & accessories
Morbidly cute homewares
Handcrafted oddities by local makers
And everything your gothic heart desires
Whether you're a long time lover of the bizarre or just creepily curious, this market is for you. Meet fellow oddity enthusiasts, shop from passionate creators, and embrace your spooky side in the heart of Wellington.
Free entry | All ages welcome | Costumes encouraged!
Don’t miss the return of the Creepy Cute Market. It's going to be wicked fun.

description:
E-Waste Drop off Day Zealandia, Drop off your unwanted electronic products during this drive-thru event!
Held in the carpark of the Zealandia, Eco Sanctuary - Please check the posts in 'discussion' for more details.
Staff will unload everything for your convenience.
We are proud to accept donations for Variety – the Children’s Charity.
FREE OF CHARGE
Computers, Monitors, Tablets and Small Devices, Laptops, Routers and Modems, Mice, Servers, UPS, Cameras, Hifi Stereo Amps and Speakers, Mobile Phones, Car Batteries, Wiring & Cabling, Mainframe Circuit Boards, etc.
CHARGED ITEMS:
• $2 Fluorescent Tubes (Normal Light bulbs not accepted)
• $3 for Media and DVD player, Keyboards, Toner Cartridges, Desk phones
• $5 per kg - Mixed Batteries
• $5 for Heaters, Microwaves, Vacuum Cleaners, AV Equipment, Small Home Appliances
• $10 for Printers, Scanners, Fax Machines
• $20 Dishwashers, Washing Machines, Dryers, Flat screen TVs
• $40 Fridges, Heatpumps and Air Con units
• $60 Large Photocopiers
Please understand charges above are for sharing the recycling cost.
Eftpos and cash accepted on site.
What we don't accept:
- CDs & DVDs
- Floppy discs
- LED lightbulbs
- Household lightbulbs
- LPG gas bottle
- Medical devices
- Glass
Other hazardous waste (e.g.)
- Paint
- Garden waste
- General chemicals
- Furniture (e.g.)
- TV cabinets

description:
Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 18 Sepember 2025, Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 18 Sepember 2025
Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 18 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
$7.50 each or multiples of 3 $20
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

description:
A night of jazz & deep house fused with live violin, A night of jazz & deep house fused with live violin
Presenting a specially curated set - a deeply emotive journey through funk, jazz and deep house to create a rich immersive soundscape, String House Project (SHP) brings their unique blend of jazz house fusion accompanied by live violin to Wellington.

Auckland DJ Lady Fee and Wellington violinist Ana Henderson unite their talents through a shared love of hypnotic beats, soaring melodies, and emotive dancefloor experiences. Lady Fee’s meticulously mixed sets are complimented by Ana’s classically trained violin, adding a soulful, improvisational edge, shaped by influences from Balkan folk and gypsy jazz to Americana and swing.

description:
AWE Partnership Concert: Double Helix with Benjamin Baker and Yura Lee, Experience Double Helix with Benjamin Baker and Yura Lee!
NOTICE OF VENUE CHANGE: Venue changed to St Andrew's on the Terrace.
We’ll be hosting an intimate violin and viola recital of international talents Benjamin Baker and Yura Lee at one of Wellington's best-known chamber music venues in the heart of the CBD. Our recent venue change to St Andrew's on the Terrace has opened up more seats than originally planned for this concert, which we are rather excited about!
Opening with Chicago composer Augusta Read Thomas’ Double Helix, this programme explores how two equal spirits intertwine, navigating a shared musical journey like a spiraling helix. International award-winning violin and viola soloist Yura Lee joins AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for an intimate exploration of both instruments — together and apart — through works by Bach, Ysaÿe, Martinů, and Mozart, interwoven with music from Aotearoa by John Psathas and Salina Fisher.
Doors open 5.15pm, concert begins at 6pm. Approx end time 7pm. Tickets $55.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
AWE Partnership Masterclass for Violists and Violinists with Yura Lee, Join us for a Masterclass!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge Festival, Orchestra Wellington will host AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee to present a masterclass for violinists and violists in Wellington.
Anyone can register to attend and observe the masterclass!
Visit https://orchestrawellington.co.nz/event/awe-masterclass-2025 to register to attend and observe the masterclass for FREE!
Violinist/violist Yura Lee is a multifaceted musician, as a soloist and as a chamber musician, and one of the very few that is equally virtuosic on both violin and viola. Her career spans three decades and takes her all over the world, captivating audiences through various musical mediums from baroque to modern, and enjoying a career that spans three decades and takes her all over the world. She has performed with major orchestras including those of New York, Chicago, Baltimore, Cleveland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and given recitals in London’s Wigmore Hall, Vienna’s Musikverein, Salzburg’s Mozarteum, the Palais des BeauxArts in Brussels, and the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam.
At age 12, she became the youngest artist ever to receive the Debut Artist of the Year prize at the Performance Today awards given by National Public Radio. She is the recipient of a 2007 Avery Fisher Career Grant; she has received numerous other international prizes, including top prizes in the Mozart, Indianapolis, Hannover, Kreisler, Bashmet, and Paganini competitions. Yura Lee was the only first prize winner awarded across four categories at the 2013 ARD Competition in Germany.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!

description:
Air Force in Concert Featuring Hollie Smith, The Royal New Zealand Air Force (RNZAF) Band is set to blast some big sounds in November. The Wellington-based band joins forces with New Zealand soul singer Hollie Smith. Together, they will take over the Michael Fowler Centre with a diverse repertoire. The RNZAF Band will perform hits from symphonic masterworks and marches to jazz standards and pop classics. Hollie will shine with several of her own famous soul songs. 
Hollie Smith is a prodigious songwriter. She has three number-one solo albums and an abundance of awards under her belt. Fat Freddy’s Drop, Trinity Roots, Anika Moa, and Boh Runga are just a few of her many collaborators. 
The RNZAF Band is a reserve force military band. It regularly welcomes dignitaries at Government House and Parliament, and provides music for commemorations at Pukeahu National War Memorial. Many of its members perform in the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, Shapeshifter, and the Rodger Fox Big Band.
Tickets available to the public from 8am on Monday, 8 September.

Prepare to be swept into a surreal cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous album release not to be missed.

description:
Alex Trask Presents | Coltrane's Soprano, Alex Trask presents a special tribute to John Coltrane, performing tunes that he played on soprano saxophone. ‘Coltrane’s soprano has been hugely influential to me as an alto player and musician. His sound on the instrument is so unique and special, it’s been a touchstone for me for years. I remember being absolutely captivated by his playing on the untitled originals when Both Directions at Once came out, when I was still a beginner player. My Favourite Things is one of my most loved albums, and Everytime We Say Goodbye from that record is some of my favourite saxophone playing ever.’

The band will play classics such as My Favourite Things and Greensleeves, as well as tunes from the albums Both Directions at Once, Duke Ellington & John Coltrane, and Impressions.

Personnel:
Alex Trask – soprano saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
Rick Cranson – drums

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place, Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.
Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:
August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers
Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.
Tickets are available from Wednesday 18 June, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.
About the Artists
Ludus
is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.
Stephen Gallagher
is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.
David Long
is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.
Jules Desmond
is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.
Oghum
is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.
Jess Chambers
is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”
The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.

description:

Cantoris is excited to announce our second concert for 2025: An Invitation to Love.

Romantic love, sacred love, and even friendship will be captured through the works of Tallis, Ireland, Whitacre, and the shimmering centrepiece of Lauridsen's Nocturnes. New works by Wellington's own Jonathan Berkahn sit alongside a vibrant selection of madrigals that capture the joy, longing, and playful spirit that love inspires.

We cannot wait to perform and share our love of this music with you.

description:
Antipodes, Antipodes is a quintet of musicians from Sydney and Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington that playfully moves between the arty/cerebral and the folksy/earthy elements of jazz and improvised music. Sometimes delicate and considered, sometimes brawny and muscular, the intent that brings their performances together is a commitment to the song: each composition is a glistening artefact, brought to dynamic life by the ensemble.

Originally formed in Berlin and drawing influences from New York to Stockholm, Antipodes has, over 10 years of touring and recording, forged their own identity: a unique triptych of North American, Northern European, and South Pacific sounds that captivates audiences, offering them a shared journey into their dreamlike and evocative co-creations.

Featuring:

Jake Baxendale (saxophone)
Callum Allardice (guitar)
Luke Sweeting (piano)
Tom Botting (bass)
Tim Geldens (drums)

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Antu Marama, The Undercurrent presents Antu Marama!

Wellington band Antü Mārama brings you the vibrant evocative folk music of Latin America, with traditional tunes and original compositions. From Chile, the UK, New Zealand and the Canary Islands the group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mapudungún word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.

The group combines both the life-giving energy and vitality of the sun with the deeper emotions and more reflective energy of the Moon. Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

Watch them perform here:
https://www.instagram.com/reel/DHcrQc2Rf0O/?igsh=bGV5cHdpeTVqMzB2⁩

Saturday 6th September
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

See you there!

description:
Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets, Witness a defining moment in this country’s jazz scene as the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) makes its highly anticipated debut at Meow Nui.
Born from a collective vision championed and inspired by jazz legend Rodger Fox, AoJO represents the shared aspirations of the jazz community – honouring our jazz lineage while serving as a platform for its future. This newly formed, and proudly national ensemble brings our country’s jazz talent and legacy into focus.
Led by Musical Director John Rae and Concert Master Oscar Lavën, with Mike Taylor (lead trumpet) and Kaito Walley (lead trombone), this concert features Duke Ellington and Billy Strayhorn’s vibrant reimagining of Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite. A groundbreaking fusion of classical and jazz, it’s hailed as one of Ellington’s most inventive works. Together Strayhorn and Ellington showcase the familiar themes of Tchaikovsky’s ballet through the expressive power of jazz in orchestral form.
Prepare to be captivated by lush orchestration and melodic innovation as the AoJO takes to the stage for the very first time.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Aunty Records Presents: Jazmine Nikitta [AUS] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Jazmine Nikitta [AUS] with Benny Salvador
Caribbean-Australian DJ Jazmine Nikitta is one of the most exciting names in global dance music right now. Fresh off her first world tour, she supported SiR across Europe and headlined parties across North and South America. She’s shared the stage with Brent Faiyaz, Bryson Tiller, Davido, Tems, and became the first Australian DJ to tour with Soulection, performing across Miami and Jamaica. Festival highlights include Splendour in the Grass, Dark MOFO, and a headline slot at Promiseland between Ms. Lauryn Hill and Tems.


Beyond the decks, Jazmine served as Spotify AUNZ’s exclusive Hip-Hop and R&B Editor (2021–24), launching Australia’s first Afrobeats and Amapiano playlist, Afro Fusion, and curating the platform’s biggest local dance playlists. She also hosted A1 The Show, a Spotify-exclusive podcast, interviewing artists like Uncle Waffles, Central Cee, and Saweetie.


She’s joined by Wellington’s Benny Salvador — DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, and one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, with releases on Rush Hour, Racquet Club, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records.


Support from Awa.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador
Get ready, Wellington—one of the most influential figures in house music is landing in the capital for a night of deep grooves, soulful rhythms, and undeniable dancefloor magic at Meow NUI.

===Tickets on sale Friday 22 August at 12.00PM====

Mark Farina is a global dance music icon whose name resonates across the scene. Known for his Mushroom Jazz series, deep house sets, and marathon all-night performances, Farina has built a career on innovation, consistency, and a relentless touring schedule of over 100 shows a year. He has collaborated with legendary venues and record labels, showcasing both classic and new school producers in his sets.

With his recent YouTube series with Defected Records and continued worldwide performances, Farina connects with both longtime fans and new audiences alike, delivering unforgettable journeys through house, jazz-infused grooves, and eclectic beats.

Supporting him is Wellington’s Benny Salvador — one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. A DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, radio host, and event promoter, Benny has shared stages with Marcellus Pittman and Courtesy and played major festivals including Splore, Beacon, and Catacombs. He has recorded mixes for Planet Trip Records, NTS, Balamii, Related Articles, and Friendly Potential Radio, and released music on Racquet Club, Rush Hour, Love Above Records, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, drawing on jazz and funk influences while showcasing his crate-digging, collaborative approach.

This is a rare chance to experience two generations of dance music mastery under one roof. From Farina’s world-renowned grooves to Benny’s forward-thinking, genre-spanning sets, the night promises a journey through sound that will move the floor and leave a lasting impression. For fans of house, jazz-infused beats, and cutting-edge underground sounds, this is a must-attend event at Meow Nui.

Saturday 18th October
Doors 9:30 PM
label: Music & Concerts

description:
BANDIT QUEEN @ The Boathouse, Nelson, BANDIT QUEEN is NZ's finest (likely only) tribute to the music of The Decemberists.A Tribute to the Decemberists? BUT WHO ARE THE DECEMBERISTS?
Hailing from Portland Oregon, The Decemberists is an indie-alt folk rock band that write epic songs and have 9 studio albums to their credit. They are renowned for their musical style and unique storytelling with many song lyrics based on historical incidents and folklore. Perhaps drawing musical influence from the likes of The Beatles, Tom Waits, REM, Morrisey, their songs are exquisitely constructed and effortlessly combine folk-rock with elements of pop creating the infectious sound that is The Decemberists.
And who is BANDIT QUEEN? Experienced Christchurch based musos - Tim Kent (vocals, acoustic guitar); Justin 'Rusty' White (lead guitar); Jo-Anne Davern Fuller (vocals, keyboard); Chiara Lowe (violin, vocals); Adam Lowe (bass); Mark Newburn (drums, percussion).
The members of BANDIT QUEEN are passionate about this project and invite you to come experience and enjoy the eclectic music of USA indie-rock band THE DECEMBERISTS.

description:
BRANT BJORK TRIO, Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

Doors at 8pm - Tickets: $60 from WaxstarTouring

description:
Back To The Hillside with Breaches & Molipane, A night of shoegaze, post-punk & grunge in the capital city.
Tickets $15 from Undertheradar or $20 on the door. First band at 8:30pm.
Back to the Hillside: Underground alt-rock/grungegaze/post-punk band from Auckland. Started off making indie pop/rock songs, Back To The Hillside are now exploring other elements. Inspired by bands/artists like The Smashing Pumpkins, Team Sleep, The Smiths, Joy Division, Titlefight & Deftones.
Breaches: Pōneke post-punk duo Breaches mix rural aggression with dance floor romance to share tales of love, death and the spaces in-between. They fuse dark electronics with the raw energy of guitars to bring a new sound that is both brooding and urgent.
Molipane: shoegaze solo act from Wellington known for dreamy, ethereal soundscapes that evoke calm and introspection.

Joined by Tommy Joass and Adam Crawford, the Deadly Sins serve up tales of hard times, hard habits, and the kind of love that leaves a mark.

For those who are meeting Bill for the first time, if the smokier, darker edge of alt-country is where you like to dwell, if the likes of Steve Earle, Michael Stipe, Bruce Springsteen or Elvis Costello feature heavily on your favourite playlist then it’s time to check out Bill Hickman.

Blending folk, country and roots influences, Bill’s set moves between grit and tenderness, with stories of outlaws, love, and life hard-lived.

Second Set; Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington - The second part of this special show features the queen of the blues and boogie piano, Cindy Muggeridge, together with the firebrand of the blues harp, Neil Billington, performing their own unique brand of blues, boogies and ballads.

Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30

Teas, coffee and snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.

description:
Bill Hickman, Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington play Hilltop, First Set; Bill Hickman - Opening the show is Wellington singer-songwriter Bill Hickman, known for his strong gravel dragged voice, driving guitar work, and honest, well-crafted songs. Blending folk, country and roots influences, Bill’s set moves between grit and tenderness, with stories of outlaws, love, and life hard-lived.

Second Set; Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington - The second part of this special show features the queen of the blues and boogie piano, Cindy Muggeridge, together with the firebrand of the blues harp, Neil Billington, performing their own unique brand of blues, boogies and ballads.

Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30

Teas, coffee and snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays and all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

More information at www.hilltophouseconcerts.co.nz/upcoming-gigs/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Bill Lake's Slow Bake, The Undercurrent presents Bill Lake's Slow Bake!

Join us for a night of swinging blues!

Guitarist, singer and songwriter Bill Lake is one of New Zealand’s most respected and long-serving practitioners. For more than four decades the singer and guitarist led the iconic country-blues band The Windy City Strugglers, as well as playing with pioneering rock group Mammal in the 70s and fronting brassy funk-rockers The Pelicans in the 80s. His songs have been covered by Midge Marsden, Darren Watson, Kokomo, Rag Poets and Marg Layton.
Bassist Steve Hemmens played with Bill in Mammal. Recently returned from many years in the UK, he adds warmth and swing to the mix.
Long time popular musician Alan Norman plays percussion, accordion, guitar and occasional piano. He is a member of both NZ’s seminal Country band The Warratahs, and Wellington band Rag Poets.

Sunday 14th September
Doors 5pm/ Gig 5:30pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Blast House, ....yeah we just wanna sit in there, right in the pocket, deep inside, and groove, and let it sit and simmer, but then poke around a bit and see what’s there ‘cos there’s all these delights right around the corners of the sounds as they travel around together deep inside simmering away with heat and fire creating kaleidoscopic reds and yellows and purples but more and all with that sound....
Blair Latham (Tenor Sax), Tyson Smith (Electric Guitar), and Paul Mouncey (Electric Bass) seek to explore the blues in a most unexpected way.
Their music is both intimate and far reaching, but more than anything else Good.

description:
Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton, Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand's best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables.
Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ's best known folk songwriters. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma­cLean. A guitarist, he is known for both his open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle style and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.
From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing and the perfect foil for Bob's lyrical songs.
Don't miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their footstomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.
Tickets $25 from Eventfinda or book by text to 02102361951
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Body Ocean, Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Bold As Brass, Join us for an uplifting afternoon of music as we welcome the warmer days with Bold As Brass – a celebration of classic brass band favourites performed by the Masterton District Brass Band, the Masterton Junior Band, and special guests!
Celebrate spring with toe-tapping tunes, stunning solos, and the unmistakable sound of Aotearoa’s only brass band in the Wairarapa.
Bring your whānau, bring your mates, and soak up the sounds of local talent in full brass bloom!

description:
Boogie Wonderland Presents: The Music of Earth, Wind & Fire, Experience the ultimate tribute to Earth, Wind & Fire with Boogie Wonderland! This powerhouse 11- piece band, created by saxophonist Bryn van Vliet for the Wellington Jazz Festival 2023, electrifies the stage with the iconic group’s legendary sounds. Featuring stunning vocals from Lisa Tomlins and LJ Crichton, and supported by a dynamic 4-piece horn section and a tight 5-piece rhythm section comprised of members from NZ's most iconic bands Fat Freddy's Drop, Kora, Shapeshifter, Lord Echo, LAB, Rhombus, TOI, and more, Boogie Wonderland delivers all the classic hits you love. Get ready to dance the night away and relive the magic of Earth, Wind & Fire like never before! 

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

description:
Brant Bjork Trio, In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.
Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.
In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.
Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brazilian Experience, Brazilian Experience is an unforgettable trip into some fabulous Latin music.
With her distinctive voice, Alda Rezende has collaborated with legendary Brazilian artists such as Elza Soares and João Bosco, recorded acclaimed albums, and headlined major festivals in New Zealand, Australia, and the USA.
Juliana Sian, a passionate interpreter of Bossa Nova and Samba, blends her own compositions with classics by Tom Jobim, Milton Nascimento, and Hermeto Pascoal, honed through over 20 years of performing and teaching.
Performing at the Jazz Festival as Brazilian Experience, Alda and Juliana are joined by renowned Brazilian and New Zealand musicians to deliver an authentic and dynamic show. Expect to dance to beloved Brazilian classics and vibrant original arrangements — a celebration of Brazil’s rich musical heritage with a unique New Zealand twist.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Broken River album release, Join the Wooden Box Band to celebrate the launch of their latest album Broken River. Recorded under the expert guidance of Lee Prebble at the Surgery in Newtown.
Written over the course of several years, the songs of Broken River tell stories of turbulence, change, immense loss and hope. They remind us to commune with our natural world and to remain steadfast in our commitments to each other.
Come together, join us in music. A salve to thrive in these confounding times, and to build the community we need.
Doors open at 7pm, music from 7:30pm

description:
Brooke Fransen - Live in Concert, Brooke Fransen - Live in Concert
An Unmissable Night of Music & Worship – Live at Whirinaki Whare Taonga

Join us for an unforgettable evening of live music in the stunning surrounds of the Whirinaki Whare Taonga Theatre on Friday, September 27.

I’ll be taking the stage with my full band for a powerful, heartfelt, and deeply worshipful night of music — and you’re invited.

We’ll be playing a full set of songs you’ll know and love, plus a few favourite covers and some brand new, never-heard-before tracks that I’m so excited to share with you for the very first time. These new songs are fresh from the heart — honest, worshipful, and full of faith.

This night is going to be so special. A space to breathe, reflect, worship, and encounter God through music. Thoughtful. Hopeful. Beautiful.

Bring your friends, your youth group, your church, your family — come and be a part of something beautiful.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brynzilian Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, Brynzilian Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival
The Brynzilian Big Band is a 17-piece powerhouse jazz orchestra founded and led by saxophonist Bryn van Vliet.

Based in Wellington, Bryn is a multi-disciplinary artist known for his dynamic career as an instrumentalist (saxophone, woodwinds, vocals), performer, composer, arranger, and educator.

As a founding member of TOI and former lead alto saxophonist for the Rodger Fox Big Band, he has earned a reputation as a versatile and sought-after musician.

The Brynzilian Big Band presents fresh, vibrant compositions inspired by iconic Brazilian music styles such as Samba, Bossa Nova, and Forró. Bryn’s writing reflects his deep affection for
Brazilian music, while honoring its traditional roots and spirit.

Featuring 17 of Wellington’s finest musicians, the Brynzilian Big Band promises a performance that will make you dance,
laugh, shout, cry — and maybe even hug your neighbour.


Check out some footage of the band here:

description:
Bullfrog Rata and The Cuba Express, Bullfrog Rata is a seasoned blues performer. For this show he will be joined by his band, The Cuba Express.
They perform a fast-paced danceable set of blues tunes along with many of the tunes from the One Fine Day and Chasing the Gazelle albums.
Both albums feature a number of personal, not self-indulgent, but highly musical and uplifting tunes.
Cuba Express is Patrick Bleakley on bass, Abe Bailey on drums and Geoff Culverwell on trumpet and keys.
Bullfrog Rata has performed with many well-known acts including Midge Marsden and The Chills, international blues acts like Taj Mahal, Watermelon Slim as well as mega stars Tina Turner, Charlie Pride, and Jethro Tull.

description:
Burgin, Kerr, & Norman, The Undercurrent presents Burgin, Kerr & Norman
A swampy melting pot of country, folk, americana and blues, they combine a mutual love of story-telling and rhythmic grooves with narratives about the human experience. Original material from each member, with a wide range of instrumentation including piano, acoustic and Weissenborn guitars, accordion, bodhran, and percussion.
Paddy Burgin (The Wooden Box Band, The Zimmermans), Andrew Kerr (ex. Jacky Tar) and Alan Norman (The Warratahs, The Rag Poets) are now a trio and have been gently gathering crowds around the greater Wellington area for the past 18 months. Alan and Andrew have a long history as a duo and Paddy was a member of ‘The Scarborough Connection’ featuring on Andrew and Alan’s critically acclaimed 2023 release ‘For the Record.’
“…..one of the year’s best albums in Americana/folk ….a thoughtful, passionate, and
musically rich collection that holds up under repeated listens….”
- Anne Hollister ⁦(www.theindiesource.com⁩)
“I’m struck by the smoothness of the production, the delicate precision of the
arrangements…what a great set of songs. What wonderful playing..”
- Simon Sweetman.
Listen here - ⁦https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V0XnzDhE-vE⁩
⁦https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FRHOXgbYuu0⁩
Saturday 27th September
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$20

description:
BØLZER - Southern Tempest Tour: Wellington - This week, BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
BØLZER - SOUTHERN TEMPEST TOUR
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla
21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar
Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr
An intuitive art project born from raw passion;
musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition
and enactment. Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical
medium largely inspired by – and seeking to
channel – the primeval essence of the human experience,
flashes of illumination will descend the sky
from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer
Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the
project first took physical form in 2008. Before
long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership
outshone any need for a bass player and
has since served to both challenge and empower the
band’s creativity. Following their 2010 live debut in
Zürich, BØLZER soon made a name for themselves
as the remarkable Swiss-Antipodean duo capable of
conjuring up mighty barriers of sound with nothing
but a ten-stringed guitar and an almost ritualistic
percussion style. The pair describe their own stage
experience as a form of spiritual rapture, an atavistic
vortex woven together from the profound union
of spectacle meeting spectator on a deeper plane.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
C'mon Masterton! an Evening of Music and Memories With Suzanne Lynch, Step back into the golden era of Kiwi pop with Suzanne Lynch – one half of the iconic sister duo The Chicks and The Ladykillers – as we celebrate the release of her memoir Yesterday When I Was Young.

Suzanne will share stories with legendary broadcaster Karyn Hay, from a career that saw her rise to fame in the late 60s, support Cat Stevens on tour, and perform alongside some of the world’s greatest musicians, as told in her new book, Yesterday When I Was Young. 

Then enjoy a live performance featuring Suzanne, joined by fellow C’mon star Shane Hales and guitar maestro Malcolm McCallum followed by a book signing.

Everyone is welcome at this event, so bring your friends and let's have a fun night filled with nostalgia!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CHORAL CONNECTIONS, NZ Secondary Students Choir + Aotearoa Academy Choir = CHORAL CONNECTIONS!
Don't miss this thrilling showcase of our best young singers in concert: Friday 26 Sept in Wellington Cathedral of St Paul. This is NZSSC’s first public concert for the 2025-26 cycle and a collaboration with Academy Choir, Gold Award winners at last years's World Choir Games. And to round off the At the end of the concert, conference delegates with join with the two youth choirs to form a massed choir of over 150 voices to sing under the direction of international choral clinician Dr Pearl Shankuan.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series Four Last Songs, Composed in the year before his passing, the 'Four Last Songs' are held by many to be Richard Strauss’ most beautiful, sensuous, and moving composition. They are songs of farewell and of gentle heartbreak. The words of the final song, 'Im Abendrot', speak of an elderly couple walking hand in hand, at rest from their wanderings, away from life. The final verse:

O weiter, stiller Friede! O vast and silent peace!
So tief im Abendrot So deep in sunset glow,
Wie sind wir wandermüde- How weary we are with wandering-
Ist dies etwa der Tod? Could this perhaps be death?

For this special premiere performance, Salina Fisher has arranged the 'Four Last Songs' for NZTrio and celebrated Australian soprano Emma Pearson.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series From Scratch, New Zealand’s oldest and most avant-garde chamber music ensemble, From Scratch, has been performing nationally and internationally since 1974, principally under the leadership of sound and intermedia artist Phil Dadson.

From Scratch have developed an original and innovative sound/performance style that includes large sculptural invented instruments (primarily percussion), and innovative hocket-style rhythms – where the performers’ individual parts interlock to create complex rhythmic and melodic structures.

The current collective core-group consists of Adrian Croucher, Shane Currey, Phil Dadson, Darryn Harkness and Chris O'Connor.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series: Four Last Songs - Wellington, CMNZ Series: Four Last Songs - Wellington
This October, Chamber Music New Zealand is proud to tour Aotearoa's own NZTrio (Amalia Hall - violin, Somi Kim - piano, Matthias Balzat - cello) and Australian soprano Emma Pearson in Four Last Songs, a concert reflecting on the nature of goodbyes, endings, and renewals.

Named for Strauss' Four Last Songs which he wrote towards the end of his life — now arranged for piano trio and soprano — the songs reflect on the serene acceptance of mortality and a closeness with nature.

The concert also features Salina Fisher's Kintsugi, about the Japanese art of putting broken ceramics back together with gold and celebrating the beauty of a life not unmarred by difficulty, but made more beautiful by the resilience of overcoming hardship.

PROGRAMME

🎶 Elena Kats-Chernin | The Spirit and the Maiden
🎶 Salina Fisher | Kintsugi
🎶 Amy Beach | 2 Songs Op. 100 A Mirage and Stella Viatoris
🎶 Sergei Rachmaninoff | Vocalise
🎶 Richard Strauss (arr. Salina Fisher) | Four Last Songs (Vier letzte Lieder) TrV 296
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Cairo Knife Fight + Sheeps Live at Meow, After ten years, Cairo Knife Fight is finally returning to New Zealand for a limited series of intimate shows. Known for their powerful live performances and genre-bending sound, the duo
is set to bring their unmistakable energy back to local stages.
Since their last performances in New Zealand, CKF has continued to push musical boundaries, earning Billboard chart success with tracks like “Churn” and “Nothing at All.”
Their latest EP, Dream Season, showcases the band's ever-evolving sound—fusing intricate live looping,
intense rhythms, and ambient textures. This homecoming is more than a tour—it’s a full-circle moment for one of NZ’s most innovative exports.
Joining CKF at Meow will be Wellington based Sheeps. Described as Art Rock for the end times, Sheeps are definitely the right band at the right time to partner CKF in 2025.
Don’t miss the return of Cairo Knife Fight. It’s been a long time coming.

Capital Blues Concert Series - Bill Hickman's Deadly Sins, Dirty country folk meets blues-soaked storytelling in this powerhouse trio led by Wellington’s own Bill Hickman.
Joined by Tommy Joass and Adam Crawford, the Deadly Sins serve up tales of hard times, hard habits, and the kind of love that leaves a mark.
For those who are meeting Bill for the first time, if the smokier, darker edge of alt-country is where you like to dwell, if the likes of Steve Earle, Michael Stipe, Bruce Springsteen or Elvis Costello feature heavily on your favourite playlist then it’s time to check out Bill Hickman.

description:
Capital Blues Presents: Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.
She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.
Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.
Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.

description:
Carmichael, The first Carmichael appearance of spring, and you’re invited! Heralding baby lambs, blossoming daffodils, and iced oat lattes, Carmichael is back to play some more music and have even more fun.

Carmichael is a six-piece jazz ensemble, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Born from the darkest depths of jazz school, Carmichael was formed by a bunch of friends to make music that’s danceable as heck and have a good time doing it together.

Inspired by different global groove-driven collectives, such as Kokoroko, Ezra Collective, Nubiyan Twist & Fat Freddy’s Drop, their music blends elements of afrobeat, neo-soul and jazz fusion.

Featuring the beloved Carmichaelians :

Lily Atu - alto saxophone & vocals
Elisa Bird - baritone saxophone
Frank Paton - trumpet
Darcy Monteath - bass
Petar Tavich - guitar
Joseph Alexander - drums
