description:
Chamber Dances, Chamber Dances
Wellington-based composer Keith Moss presents the premiere of his new work Chamber Dances, written for marimba, reed quintet, and percussion.

This piece for seven musicians brings two long-held personal wishes to life: to compose a work in collaboration with marimba virtuoso Naoto Segawa, and to create a reed quintet inspired by close friends in Belgium.

The Post praised Keith’s most recent orchestral work, performed by Orchestra Wellington and Arohanui Strings, as “a pleasant, multi-hued piece of tone-painting.” His latest compositions mark a return to a tonal vocabulary that is both approachable and emotionally resonant for audiences.

The concert program will also feature solo marimba works by Peter Klatzow, a marimba duo by Akira Yuyama, and a newly arranged reed quintet version of Grieg’s Holberg Suite. Keith’s fresh take on this beloved classic draws from both Grieg’s original piano score and the composer’s own string arrangement, distilling the spirit of the suite into a sparkling new form for reed quintet.

Taking the stage is marimba specialist Naoto Segawa, Principal Percussionist of Orchestra Wellington. He is joined by fellow OW musicians and NZSO Sub-principal Sam Rich, who brings a vibrant palette of exotic percussion to the performance.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Christof van der Ven - Abandoned Brewery - Lower Hutt, Christof van der Ven - Abandoned Brewery - Lower Hutt
After 5 years Christof is coming back to New Zealand to tour his newly released album.

He plays at the Abandoned Brewery taproom in Petone on the 30th of October.

Christof van der Ven has built a truly impressive CV over the course of his career, from supporting the likes of Bon Iver, The Staves, Mel Parsons, Bear’s Den, Lisa Hannigan, and Nick Mulvey, to playing in front of thousands of fans across the world.

Hailing originally from Holland, Christof van der Ven moved to Galway in 2007 before settling in London. He has released two LPs, Empty Handed (2018) and You Were The Place (2019), alongside multiple EPs. His career has been supported by DIY, Clash, Gold Flake Paint and his music has been played on BBC6 Radio and Radio X.

NEW ALBUM “Is this what we’ve become?”

Throughout ‘is this what we’ve become?’ Christof speaks to loved ones and past selves, reflecting on years of promise, regret and loss. His storytelling is characterized by gentle melodies and rich, textured arrangements, as his younger selves confront him with unfulfilled ambitions and perceived failures. When Christof turns towards friends and family, he finds them too in moments of upheaval, in need of support. Amidst the unpredictable and uncontrollable, community and friendship emerge, providing roots, giving comfort as Christof ruminates on how he came to be - and can come to accept - who he is now.

Written by Christof, ‘is this what we’ve become?’also features musical contributions from Jools Owen (Bear’s Den, Bess Atwell), Tommy Heap (Billie Marten, Matthew and the Atlas), Marcus Hamblett (Villagers, Bear’s Den), and Estilo String Quartet. The album was produced and recorded by Christof and Ian Grimble (Daughter, Manic Street Preachers, Matt Corby, Fionn Regan), who also mixed the LP. ‘is this what we’ve become?’ incorporates recordings from both studio sessions in London, as well as ad hoc recording sessions engineered by Christof across the UK.

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour
Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder.

Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.

This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”

A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.

With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.

Opening for Rivers is Beans:

Beans is a recent fixture in the Pōneke folk scene, importing a wild array of original songs and generally embodying the classic singer songwriter formula – introvert plus guitar. They are one third of folk trio 'Don & the Divorcees', but are known for solo shows which are rich with humour, honesty and interesting word choices. Expect to feel things.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder. Band members are Kerrie McEwen, Tonnie ten Hove, & Momoko Sato.
Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.
This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”
A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.
With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.
For updates, and behind-the-scenes glimpses, visit www.coletteriversmusic.com or follow @colettemusic on Instagram and Facebook.
Opening for Rivers are artists:
Phil Masters
Phil Lively-Masters is an experienced, well travelled singer songwriter who specialises in writing the sort of Sun Kissed West Coast Laurel Canyon Americana that made Neil Young, Stephen Stills and the Byrds famous. With a powerful, honey soaked voice that has won praise and support slots from legendary American country rock pioneers like The Jayhawks and original cosmic cowboy Steve Young, Phil has 20 years worth of road worn original songs to pull on, including tracks from the critically acclaimed CANYON RYDE album 'Free To Be' and some choice country rock covers to weave a spell on any listener.
Saali Marks
A singer, songwriter, guitarist and multi-instrumentalist, Saali Marks hails originally from the
South Island, but has made Wairarapa his home for the last 20 years, where he lives on a farm
with his family and teaches music at Kuranui College.
Saali has played in numerous bands over the years, in a wide range of styles from proto-punk
to psychedelic dub, covers, originals and fully improvised music with no discernible genre, on
stages throughout Aotearoa since 1991. Currently he fronts the Wellington ska band Battleska
Galactica.
Throughout and alongside it all Saali has indulged his love for songwriting and solo
performing, developing a unique style, rooted in folk and blues, and inspired by greats from
across the decades. A skilled guitarist, Saali rarely plays straight ahead chords, and an
education in jazz has informed his ear for harmony, the beauty of dissonance, tension and
resolution, with unconventional song structures, alternate tunings and intriguing melodies.
Although not adverse to penning the odd love song, most of Saali’s lyrics tend to focus on
other aspects of the human condition, from religion and politics to our relationships with the
environment and our own minds.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Come Together – Led Zeppelin II, New Zealand’s most successful rock series ever, COME TOGETHER, celebrates five amazing years with one of the biggest albums ever!

This isn't just a concert; this is an immersive, once-in-a-lifetime experience where some of the most talented musicians in the country pour everything they have into recreating these albums with absolute precision and passion. Every guitar riff, soaring vocal, thunderous drumbeat, and intricate keyboard melody is delivered with an attention to detail that honours the original recordings while injecting new energy into these classic songs.

LED ZEPPELIN II
Prepare for a full-throttle rock and roll explosion. Led Zeppelin II is, hands down, one of the heaviest, hardest-hitting albums ever made. Our Come Together musicians LOVE performing Zeppelin, and this show is going to shake the foundations of every venue we hit.

Lineup
Jennie Skulander, Julia Deans, Seamus Johnson, Milan Borich, Brett Adams, Matthias Jordan, Mike Hall, Alistair Deverick, Finn Scholes & more.

description:
DJMALLGOTH / Sanctit(t)y_ROMance / BONDST, DJMALLGOTH / Sanctit(t)y_ROMance / BONDST
DJMALLGOTH is a drummer, VJ and music producer from Bristol, UK, creating a sound which both pushes sonic boundaries in production, and revives sounds that have undeservingly left the zeitgeist of modern electronic music. The forefront of the show is live percussion, with all drum breaks played out on a kit in time with heavy, morphing basslines and twisted, chopped vocals.

https://www.youtube.com/@heyyitsbenji

---

Sanctit(t)y_ROMance is a noise/dance project by Sophia Frudd. Harsh Drum Beats over echoing, billowy syncopations of desperate fallen angels, covered in tar. Aching, squealing one-liners to seethe and dwell in.

https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1996462460

---

BONDST makes their first foray into live electronic performance, with members combining their interests of free improvisation as Integument, shared love of techno parties, and hardware fetishist production. Expect morphing feedback loops driven by kick drums across instinct-led structures.

https://www.instagram.com/bondst.nz/

$15 presales via UTR
$20 on door

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

Dads Army - New Orleans Trombone Special, The music of Canal St in New Orleans, with an emphasis on Trombones. The DADS have been playing and singing New Orleans traditional swing and blues for 15 years or more, and this iteration is heaps of fun!

Have you ever wondered how many trombones is too many trombones? Well you are about to find out! Will be a raucous, memorable, and thoroughly entertaining show.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

After dropping Go Go Go, Lovebomber, and her hottest single yet SUCKERPUNCH, pop-punk artist Dani Josie is headlining her first-ever nation wide tour.

description:
Daniel Champagne (Australia) LIVE at Martinborough Town Hall (7pm Show), Show #1 - SOLD OUT
Second show announced by popular demand!
The young virtuoso recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation” has spent the past few years selling out shows all over the globe and will be bringing his dynamite live act back to New Zealand in 2025 for a series of intimate regional concerts!
Seated show
Family friendly  
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s because live music is for everyone!
BYO (non alcoholic) drinks and nibbles 
October 19, 2025 @ Martinborough Town Hall
Doors open from 6:30pm / show starts at 7:00pm (8:10pm finish) 
Tickets are VERY limited. DON'T miss out!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY..
“The word Prodigy seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills, he coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
The Calgary Herald, CANADA

“Today I saw the future of Folk – Festival goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.” The Firefly Column, USA

“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads. Fusing the strong traditions of Blues, Folk and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.” The Indie Blender, CANADA

“reinventing roots guitar” Rhythms Magazine, AUSTRALIA“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once in a lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy that plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.” BW Review, NEW ZEALAND

“Daniel Champagne exudes a natural ease on stage, as he sings poignant lyrics and beautifully crafted melodies that invariably whisk the heart up with grand romanticism. Coupled with an exhilarating guitar talent that transcends mere acoustic playing to replicate a whole band, Champagne is just magical” Themusic.com.au, AUSTRALIA

"You feel as if he just invented the instrument yesterday and was discovering its possibilities afresh” Ted Gioia (American jazz critic and music historian)
label: Music & Concerts

description: Davey Griffiths & Celine Filbee, Davey and Celine have crafted their diverse set around shared love of the blues, a funky groove and beautiful ballads, including originals and covers also encompassing americana and roots music. You can expect to laugh at their humorous take on some songs, cry at the beautiful ballads they partner on and be toe tapping to their groove. Davey’s acute ear and sound experience allow him to distil the very essence of a song and craft arrangements showcasing the underlying groove inherent in his playing. His voice, reserved, yet soulful and resonant along with his sympathetic guitar chops, elevate Celine’s and other songs to new and sometimes surprising places. Celine provides rhythm guitar and a powerhouse vocal performance, she can own the biggest banger, feel the suffering of a blues standard or dial it right back to expose all the sentiment in a ballad.

description:
Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna, Debt Club celebrate the release of their debut EP “Taste For Stout” with a special show in Pōneke, joined by friends and powerhouse live acts Model Home and Wiri Donna.
Formed in 2023, Debt Club have quickly made their mark with a dynamic, guitar-driven sound that blends anthemic hooks with thoughtful lyricism. Following the release of singles “Little Lines” and “Windows,” both featured on “Taste For Stout”, the band are set to mark this milestone with their biggest show yet.
Ōtautahi legends Model Home bring their kiwi take on midwest emo, earning massive attention with their 2023 debut album “…And Nobody Made A Sound” and a bunch of student radio hits.
Wiri Donna, led by Bianca Bailey, are a commanding indie rock force whose high energy shows and acclaimed EP’s Being Alone and In My Chambers have made them one of Aotearoa’s most exciting live acts.
San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

description:
Donál Gunning, Every Wednesday, come down to Moon for FREE live music from 6.30pm, all pizzas $15 from 5.30-9pm

Dónal Gunning is a singer songwriter from Dublin, Ireland. He draws on rock, folk, indie and punk influences.

Now based in Wellington, New Zealand his debut solo single Homesick released in October 2023. Homesick is a song dedicated to the masses who have emigrated their motherland for opportunity and adventure. It tells the story of the struggle in leaving friends and family.

His debut EP Born to Perform released in May 2024. The EP was inspired and written while travelling New Zealand, Portugal and Ireland.

Donal has released two singles in 2025 Your 1 & Losing Weight both of which have received tremendous praise globally. He is set to release a second EP later this year. He knows how to work the crowd and always brings fun, energy and Irish charm through his thought-provoking lyrics and formative sound

description:
Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time, Event Information
Some days remind us who we are and where we come from — when an entire nation moves as one to honour Independence.
To celebrate the 80th Anniversary of Vietnam’s National Day (2 September), Viet Hub NZ proudly presents
“Echoes of Home – A Musical Across Time”
This free concert is a heartfelt journey through the sounds of Vietnamese history — from nostalgic childhood songs to powerful wartime ballads and modern melodies of pride and hope. All performances will include English subtitles, making it easy for everyone to follow along and connect with the stories.
Whether you’re Vietnamese or simply curious about a different culture, this is a wonderful opportunity to experience the warmth, resilience, and beauty of Vietnam through music and storytelling.
🎁 Raffle with Over $300 in Prizes
Don’t miss our special raffle on the day. Tickets will be available at the venue for $5 and $10. Payment can be made in cash or by bank transfer.
💛 Support Viet Hub NZ
This event is free to attend, but if you believe in what we do and want to help us continue running community workshops, cultural events, and youth-led initiatives — please consider making a donation.
👉 Donate here: https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/viet-hub-nz-rooted-in-culture-powered-by-community
Your koha helps keep our work going, rooted in culture, powered by community.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Echoes of Us - WJF 2025, Echoes of Us is a live, improvised music experience where you are the muse. In an evening of deep reflection, spontaneous creativity and genuine musicianship, a house band fronted by saxophonist and woodwind doubler Zoe Ioannou, invites you as the audience to share personal moments, memories, or themes—light-hearted, emotional, joyful, tender–anything you desire. These offerings are then to be transformed into rich, evolving soundscapes created in real-time by the musicians. Perfectly set in the warm, intimate and light atmosphere of Whisky and Wood, this event offers an invitation to slow down, listen deeply, and feel heard in a way words alone often cannot achieve. Come as you are—your story may become the music that moves and echoes us all at Wellington Jazz Festival 2025.
Doors open 4.30pm for a 5pm start.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, 🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington – Launch Event ✨🌟
With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn, Wellington
Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to bring Ecstatic Dance Wellington to life! 🎉 This is the launch event, and we can’t wait to co-create the first of many transformational dance journeys with you.
💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.
🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, weaves deep bass, tribal rhythms, and world sounds into journeys that move both body and soul. With over 8 years of Ecstatic Dance DJing experience, a DJ Teacher, and 24 years as a DJ - Kimba creates alchemical spaces of release, joy, and transformation. Originally from Auckland, she ran Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years & runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival. She is excited to bring her skills to the dance floor!
🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Sound & closing with Bernie
🎟 Tickets
$25 online
$30 cash on the door
❤️ What to Bring
Socks (floor can be cool)
Yoga mat, cushion, or blanket if you’d like to rest
Loose, comfy clothes
Warm layers for afterwards
A friend!
🌟 Guidelines
Drug & alcohol free
No talking on the dance floor
No phones/cameras
Respect the space & each other
🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/
✨ Come help us launch Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

description:
FREE POP UP GIG - CUBA BARBERS, Untitled Warehouse Project is known for transforming found spaces into raves, taking over unexpected venues and reimagining them as dance floors. From warehouses to theatres, no space is off limits.
This time, we’re bringing the party to Cuba Barbers for a one-off pop-up gig, this Friday, September 5th from 5:30-8:30 pm.
This event is free entry, with DJs all evening. Swing by on your after-work route, or drop in before your night out, to dance, hang out, and get a taste of what’s coming.
This event is part of the lead-up to ‘Omnia’, our two-night takeover of the Hannah Playhouse this September.
Tickets for Omnia available now via iTicket:
https://www.iticket.co.nz/events/2025/sep/omnia?view=info
label: Music & Concerts

description:
FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK), FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK)
We’re back for one last jam - and we’re going out with a bang! Join us for an extended party session at Parrotdog, with special guest DJ Audit from Auckland. The last time we teamed up at The Yotty (RIP) in Raglan, it was the stuff of legend. Let’s make it happen again - see you on the dancefloor!

FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format. The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.” Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon. Now based in Bali, FUNKIN’ DONUTS is going global - relaunching with a fresh, dancefloor-focused energy.

Joining us from Tāmaki Makaurau: DJ Audit

Since 1998, Audit has been crafting an eclectic sound that transcends genres while staying rooted in Hip Hop culture. A lifelong record collector and open-format DJ, his sets seamlessly weave Disco, Hip Hop, Soul, Cumbia, and Latin rhythms into vibrant journeys. With decades of experience, a deep appreciation for musical diversity, and an instinct for reading the crowd, Audit creates electric atmospheres that keep the audience moving.

Host with the most: Flex Webster

Flex Webster lives and breathes music. A DJ, producer, and record collector with a career spanning almost three decades, his journey has taken him around the globe. Flex’s sound blends Afrobeat, Latin, Funk, Hip Hop, Reggae, Disco, and House, reflecting the soulful rhythms of the African diaspora. Don’t miss this rare B2B with old mate Audit - your last chance to catch Flex for a while, as he returns to Bali to bring his magic back to the Island of the Gods.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

The world’s biggest family-friendly rave just got haunted… and Wellington, we’re coming for YOU! 👻

This is not your average Halloween party – it’s a full-blown Halloween rave for the whole family, packed with banging beats, dazzling performers, and spooky surprises at every turn. Whether you’re a mini-monster or a grown-up ghoul, get ready for an afternoon of music, mayhem, and memories you’ll never forget. Costumes are highly encouraged – the more outrageous, the better!

Location The Hunter Lounge

Second Release - ON SALE NOW

description:
First Reserve, Dropper & Elly Mae, Get ready for another memorable night out as First Reserve & Dropper share the bill with rising star Elly Mae. This will be an evening to feast your ears on a diverse soundscape of angular guitars, melodic goodness, and glorious noise.

Here’s the lo-down:

First Reserve is inevitable. Before adopting the moniker in 2023, Ryan Connaghan had been prolifically writing music that communicated their experiences in life, love, and loneliness. These themes are all approached on songs like “Last One” and “Me & My Friends” – the first offerings from First Reserve’s debut EP set for release in late 2025. On stage, their sound is both intimate and larger-than-life, combining influences from alt-rock, indie-folk, and pop.

Dropper combines intuitive songwriting sensibilities with wall-of-sound, guitar.  Blending noise and melody, Dropper is dynamic, song-centred, high-energy indie rock. Often compared to Bob Mould’s work with Hüsker Dü or Lou Barlow's early Sebadoh, they’ve been described by one review as having a "high energy stage performance punctuated by flawless musicianship and songwriting skills that seems beyond the years...Honestly, it’s hard to overstate how impressed I was with Dropper and am eagerly awaiting my next chance to see them live.”

Elly Mae's music encapsulates the bittersweet complexities of growth, relationships, time escaping, and the nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, shoegaze and whatnot.

Grab your general release tickets online for just $15! Or, even better, grab an early bird ticket for only $10 and secure your spot for a night of unforgettable live music. Doors at 8pm, first act on at 8:30pm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Fizzwizard plays T-Bone Walker, Pōneke raised guitar slinger Aleister 'Fizzwizard' Campbell storms home from Tāmaki Makaurau to lead a stellar sextet through a set of sophisticated blues by electric guitar pioneer T-Bone Walker.
At the crossroads where Blues and Jazz meet, you'd be sure to find Aaron Thibeaux Walker. Better known to his fans as 'T-Bone', he pioneered the electric guitar in The Blues, directly influencing every great blues player who came after him, and through Chuck Berry on Rock 'n' Roll. Often performing with jazz musicians, his music was refined and sophisticated, infused with the perfect amount of rough edge and grit, and always devilishly swinging.
Joining Aleister for this one-off gig are a sensational Auckland rhythm section, an exuberant Wellington horn section, and special guest Paul Dyne making a rare outing on keys!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Freak Slug - Wellington, Manchester based musician Freak Slug - the project of Xenya Genovese - will be welcoming audiences in Pōneke Wellington and Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland into her dreamy indie-pop world this October.

Hugely influenced by ‘90s cult heroes including Ride, Mazzy Star and Stephen Malkmus, Freak Slug is all about hitting a mood. Everything that fuels her creative output is raw, authentic, sometimes weird, but always totally true self-expression. I Blow Out Big Candles is a strong statement of all of this and more. Down there, picking through the curious mix of sounds and feelings, from nostalgic, ‘90s-influenced and dreamy as well as eccentric and experimental, lives Freak Slug.

The 10-track project gives listeners a taste of what they will be in for at her Aotearoa shows, a journey of both soft soulfulness and sonic songwriting, all laid out on the table.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Free Status, Free Status is a jazz fusion band, drawing melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.

At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can’t wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.

The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand’s jazz greats.

On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.

On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America’s Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.

On vocals is Melody Lui-Webster, an award-winning singer and accomplished musical theatre performer and actor, with numerous professional stage and television roles.

Thank you for watching!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Friday Jazz at The Runholder, Friday Jazz at The Runholder
Join us at The Runholder for a late afternoon jazz concert with The Sunflowers Jazz Trio from Wellington.

Inspired by legends like Anita O’Day and Sarah Vaughan, The Sunflowers bring timeless jazz classics to life on the guitar, vocals & double bass, delivering renditions from the Great American Songbook with style, soul & swing.

From 4pm, you'll be able to sip a Lighthouse Gin & Tonic and enjoy a shared Runholder platter while listening to the jazz session. The concert will wrap up at 6pm and we invite you to stay and enjoy dinner with us.

$49 per person (payable on the evening) includes a Lighthouse Gin & Tonic on arrival, concert and shared platter at your table. Reserve your table at www.therunholder.co.nz/book

description:
Funky Fridays Vol. 7 - Not My Sister, Libby K, Ben-Jammin, We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Libby K, Ben-Jammin & our host Not My Sister!
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Libby K
11.30-1 Ben Jammin
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista

www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington, Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform, Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor, where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting, emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo, house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love xx
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic

https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj
BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol, UK, Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl, studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks, he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's, producers and musicians in Aotearoa, Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival, Cuba Dupa, Kiwi Burn, Little Monsters, Insomnia, Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub, Laughton Kora, Pheonix Foundation), Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia, Y, Sorchalula,Young Gho$t, House MD), Cuba Dupa, Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne), Cafe Blue (UK), Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive, comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new, classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.
https://soundcloud.com/ben_young_2000
label: Music & Concerts

description:
GENERAL KALA LIVE at Le Cafe, Picton, GENERAL KALA LIVE at Le Cafe, Picton
General Kala - Described as "Ultravox meets Kate Bush"
Founded in 2013, Wellington-based General Kala's first live performance was two years later, by which time they had a 90-minute set of original, synthesiser-driven music. The original lineup of Cusiel (vocal and synth), Spence (synths and vocal) and Mathiassen (drums) is still in place for 2025, with six EPs to be released this April and May (plus another six by 2026) through Pulse Science Recordings.
Taking their lead from classic analog-synth acts of the late 1970s and early '80s, as well as progressive and rock luminaries of both decades, Kala infuses visceral, soaring, melodic dance composition with vintage synthesis and syncopated rhythm
Now based in Auckland, the band will bring their singular sound to Le Cafe in Picton.
https://www.generalkala.com/
https://generalkala.bandcamp.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.
Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon including more music, poetry, live-scored cinema, and a travelling DJ stage curated by Tonic Collective.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Girls Rock the Boys (Wellington), Girls Rock the Boys is bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage. With Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, Jude Madill, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, and a stellar band backing them up, it's bound to be a night of high-energy performances.

This from our last gig...

"Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking - check them out!"

An electrifying time warp! The 70s were a golden era for rock, with bands like Journey, Led Zeppelin, Whitesnake, and Deep Purple defining the sound of an entire generation. The idea of powerhouse female vocalists fronting a live band, belting out classics from these legends, is pure magic.

Early bird tickets are just $20, while door sales are $30—so it's definitely worth grabbing them early. This show is going to be an absolute blast, so securing those cheaper tickets ahead of time is a smart move.

description:
Goodthings Session #016 - Wellington - September 27th, Goodthings Session #016 - Wellington - September 27th
✨ Goodthings Session #016 ✨
📅 Saturday, September 27th
📍 The Pow Wow Room, Wellington
⏰ 8PM till late

Twelve DJs. One room. Zero chance of sitting still. We’re back at The Pow Wow Room for another round of controlled chaos, running full open format — house, garage, RnB, breaks, bass, and the kind of late-night rollers that make you forget what time it is.

And yep, we’re filming the whole thing in 360 boiler room style, so whether you’re front and center, tucked in the back, or pulling questionable moves by the bar, it’s all getting caught on camera.

If you’ve hit a Goodthings session before, you know the vibe. If you haven’t… well, here’s your chance.

description:
Gordo And Teej Present: Craigslist, Craigslist are a party, record label and DJ outfit operated by Colter Carson (Public Possession) and Raffeal Hamblett. Since humble beginnings in 2020, the project aims to create shared moments of joy with an aesthetic centred on obscure records. The success of this manifesto is reflected in the consistently positive response gained from partygoers and label supporters alike, year after year.⁣
⁣
In the DJ booth, Colter and Raffy (Craigslist Soundsystem) strike a delicate balance between eclecticism and danceability that denotes a deep understanding of musical traditions and club culture. Defying the confines of genre and era, the pair bring a refreshing and joyous sound to the dancefloor.⁣

Gordo & Teej are proud to present iconic Ōtautahi due Craigslist, after dancing to these guys all summer at Flux, Smash Palace, Electric Ave and Two Minds festivals we just had to fly 'em up to show the Pōneke whānau how these guys get the dance floor cranking. Expect nothing less than the finest Italo disco grooves, chunky house beats and uptempo club music to transport you to a sun soaked festival light years away from the welly winter.

description:
Greg Crayford's Jazz Night - Twenty Year Anniversary!, Twenty years! Yep, you read that right. This residency has run for two solid decades.
Greg Crayford here. Host and drummer of what’s been billed for some time now as Wellington’s Longest-Running Jazz Residency. And rightly so! Little could we have known when this gig began at The Realm in Hataitai in August 2005 that it’d still be going in 2025. It’s a fantastic achievement. Longer residencies have occurred in our town but nothing currently running holds a candle to that sort of effort by a single artist, at a single venue, in this town (and possibly beyond).
We boast quite the legacy: two Tui-nominated live albums, several bar owners, many managers and staff, hundreds of featured professional musicians and young artists, 500-odd gigs, uncountable numbers of pizzas, beer, whisky, and much laughter and joy. From local music students to top-notch international artists we’ve seen it all.
It’s a huge milestone - 20 years of high quality music played by a massive variety of talented people.
The exciting programme is largely finalised and is pasted below.
Mark the date!
Table bookings 04 974 2207 or info.therealm@nzvenueco.nz or therealm.co.nz and click on ‘book a table’
Great ambience, good company, superb kai and stellar music. What more could a jazz fan want? How about twenty years of quality music?
Sure hope to see you there

Gregory Alan Isakov,   American indie-folk artist Gregory Alan Isakov is a Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter. He’s bringing his intimate and lyric-driven show to Wellington in February. Audiences will be given a special opportunity to experience stripped-down acoustic arrangements. He’ll delve into favourites from six of his full-length studio albums, including his most recent ‘Appaloosa Bones’. 
This 2023 album was praised with an Associated Press reviewer saying, “His new songs are relentlessly majestic, a kind of musical morphine”. Gregory has amassed a devoted community of fans who have helped him garner over 1 billion streams on listening platforms to date.

description: Heaven & Earth: Celebrating 25 Years of Bold Sounds, Heaven & Earth marks 25 years of Stroma’s fearless exploration of sound and spirit since our inaugural concert Wind, Rain & Light in August 2000. We recall the theme of that first concert by similarly evoking musical impressions of the earth below and the sky above. Featuring a world premiere by New York-based NZ composer Leila Adu-Gilmore, the programme includes Olivier Messiaen’s ecstatic Louange à l’immortalité de Jésus, Gemma Peacocke’s Sky Fields, John Rimmer’s Where Sea Meets Sky 2, Michael Norris’s new piano trio The Spaces In Between, and—to mark the recent passing of Sofia Gubaidulina—her meditative Garden of Joy and Sorrow. Come join us in celebrating a quarter century of intrepid sonic exploration from the musicians of Stroma.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Hobnail at Kapiti Playhouse, Hobnail are celebrating the release of their new album "Three Part" with a national tour. “Three Part” (out July 2025) is the 8th album from Wellington’s Hobnail. The new album features Hobnail’s take on songs by some of their favourite Kiwi and Australian bands and songwriters, including Don McGlashan, Barry Saunders, the Waifs, Nick Cave, and more.. These versions highlight the vocal and instrumental interplay between these 3 exceptional musicians.
Hobnail are a Wellington institution. They have played shows everywhere from Pittsburgh to Paekakariki, New Plymouth to Norfolk Island, Auckland to Amsterdam, Germany to Gore, the Canadian Praries to the Canterbury Plains. They are 3-time finalists at the New Zealand Music Awards (Best Folk Album and Best Country Song twice).
"Refreshingly down-to-earth and lovely with vocals so tightly knit they could be family"
label: Music & Concerts

Wellington’s all female New Orleans style street band playing funky tunes with a brassy vibe.
Upstairs at the Vogelmorn Bowling Club.
Doors at 7pm, music starting at 730pm.
$15 from Under The Radar, or $20 on the door.
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com.

Hori i.n.c Presents: Grace Chia, Straight outta Tasmania and back on Aotearoa soil Grace Chia returns to Pōneke with a soul-stirring, unapologetic set that blends poetic roots, hard-hitting hip-hop, and raw, soulful RnB.
Fresh off festival stages like MONA FOMA, PITP, and Twisted Frequency, Grace brings the same fire that’s seen her share the stage with Drapht, Allday, Cash Savage and Dirty Dike. This isn’t just music this is protest, poetry, and pure presence.

description:
Hour of Power, Get ready for the jab – a true Vaccination for the Soul. This is a hip trip packed with funk, soul, R&B, and a touch of jazz, all locked into a pocket so deep you might never climb out.
Hour of Power is bringing you a full hour dedicated to the legendary Tower of Power. Our large horn section will fire off riffs, and the rhythm section will lock in the groove.
Whether you’re a funk veteran or new to the groove, expect high-energy hits, sizzling solos, and a vibe that’ll keep you moving.
Frida Flacks (vocals), Kaia Johnstone (trumpet), Sylvester Green (trumpet), Frank Paton (Trumpet) Will Hanlon (tenor sax), Alex Vujanic (tenor sax), Tai Van Der Bar (baritone sax), Sam Hudson (trombone), Petar Tavich (guitar), Blair Gowan (piano), Jack Harris (bass), and Jojo Alexander (drums).

description: Hummingbird House Jazz Trio, Join us in our lounge bar for our house Jazz Trio, Saturdays nights 9:30 - 11:30. Occupying a prominent corner spot on Courtenay Place, there’s something magnetic about Hummingbird, A fixture in Wellington hospitality since the turn of the millennium, The fitout is moody in a quintessentially Wellington way: deep green tiled bar, low lighting, and a layout that flows between the reimagined main space and a seductive lounge that occupies the old Betty’s bar. With a substantial food menu served all evening, and the sound of cocktails being shaken alongside our baby grand piano.

description: Illicit Love, Step into a world of secrets for this one-night-only prohibition-style speakeasy, packed with live jazz, bootleg cocktails, and a dance floor ready for rebels and romantics alike. Slip past the watchful eye of the ‘authorities’ and step into a world where love is bold, the drinks flow freely, and the music never stops. Enjoy handcrafted cocktails featuring The Bond Store’s award-winning spirits, paired with decadent bites designed for sharing. The night kicks off with big brass energy from a live jazz band, leading into a high-energy celebration of love, freedom, and the thrill of breaking the rules. Drape yourself in 1920s glamour, grab your partner in crime, and prepare for a night of indulgence, mischief, and unforgettable memories. But remember...loose lips sink ships, so keep the password hush-hush.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jack Hooker - Live Music Wednesdays, Jack Hooker is an acoustic guitarist and electronic musician, known for his immersive electronic music and intricate fingerstyle guitar. His output spans solo guitar, the groups The Shocking and Stunning and Ambient Ousìa, and many international collaborations across Indonesia, the Philippines, Greece and beyond. He will be performing a set of original acoustic guitar works. Expect expansive steel-string soundscapes with intricate fingerpicking, tapping techniques, and open tunings.

As always, entry is free and $15 pizza specials will be available!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jade Merematira - Te Wiki o te Reo Māori ko Marama, Jade Merematira is a rising voice in Aotearoa’s scene, weaving honeyed vocals and heartfelt storytelling into every performance. With a sound that flows effortlessly between soul, R&B, and the rich emotional currents of her Cook Island Māori heritage, Jade invites listeners into an intimate space of warmth, reflection, and aroha.

Following the release of her debut single Finding Love, and its soulful follow-up The Siren, Jade is quickly establishing herself as a unique and powerful artist with a message worth hearing.

On September 17th, Jade brings her soulful energy to Moon Bar in Newtown, celebrating Te Wiki o te Reo Māori with a night of music that honours this land and it’s language. Expect stirring original tracks alongside tender covers of some of her favourite waiata – all delivered with grace and love.

Join us for an evening where soul meets whakapapa, and let Jade Merematira guide you through a night of connection, culture, and sound.

Free entry - all pizzas $15 all night
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Composer Series | Blair Latham And Anton Wuts, Sh*t gets Wild

Anton and Blair at the Rogue!

Anton Wuts and Blair Latham are back orchestrating their head turning take on music for a large ensemble, but this time with a new twist. 
TWO quintets!

Drums and Bass and Harmony and Horns, Drums and Bass and Harmony and Horns, are they side by side or head to head?? Do they work in harmony, (so to speak), for the betterment of all ears or do they take a cue from the world around us??

Only the music can and will divulge its sonorous secrets.
Join them and their cohorts on Friday the 17th of October 7pm.

Featuring:
Shaun Anderson & Peter Elliot ~ Drum kit
Alistair Isdale & Paul Mouncey ~ Basses
Tyson Smith & Dayle Jellyman ~ Harmonic Sound Generators
Jake Baxendale & Anton Wuts ~ Alto Saxophones
Oscar Laven & Blair Latham ~ Tenor Saxophones
Michael Costello ~ Trumpet

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: A Hot Time in the Old Town, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

SOLD OUT for the past two years at the Edinburgh Fringe. Ali Affleck was invited to open the CopenhagenJazz Fest in 2023 with this show. Come hear this award-winning vocalist (& jazz historian) with local Wellington band playing with authenticity the bawdy music that inspired such scandalous parties. Low-slung blues, scorching swing jazz and crossover folk hits from 1851-1933.

'Masterclass in grassroots jazz/blues' ***** (Edinburgh49.org).

'Not a household name yet – she soon will be' (BBC Jazzhouse).

‘Vivacious’ (Herald).

Six-time nominee for Best Vocalist (Scottish Jazz Awards)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Alex Keatley's Sounds of the Motherland, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Double bassist, bandleader and composer Alex Keatley presents Sounds from the Motherland — a vibrant and deeply personal journey into the rich world of South African jazz. Blending the infectious grooves of Cape jazz, the joyous spirit of kwela, and the harmonic sophistication of post-bop, this project pays tribute to the music of Abdullah Ibrahim, Nduduzo Makhathini, Bheki Mseleku, and Winston Mankunku Ngozi while offering bold new compositions inspired by their legacy.

Starting this project while studying his undergraduate degree at the University of Auckland Jazz School, Alex's band consists of friends he has met during his time studying in Auckland and is excited to share with you what they have been working on for the past year. Come along and enjoy the music with us.

Featuring:

- Na'amah Cheiban
- Francesca Parussini
- Jenna Aspeling
- Will Ralph
- Iggy Palmero Epstein
- Ryan Tomov
- Finn McNeill
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Alex Trask Quartet - Imaginary Folksongs, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.
Alex Trask’s ‘Imaginary Folksongs’ blends Earth folk music with a speculative style from an imaginary place. Inspired by bluegrass, Scottish folk music, and jazz performance practice, the tunes have a simplicity in common. Free improvised sections contrast carefully arranged melodies, allowing creativity and structure to coexist. The fiddle-esque melodies and straightforward harmonies create an open and inviting sound that changes depending on the musicians on stage. Performing this music as a group invites each member to paint their private imaginings, creating a unique collective folklore. The quartet will also perform a selection of tunes that inspired the music, including songs by Brian Blade, Gordon Lightfoot, and traditional melodies.

Alex Trask – saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Ateo Buhne quartet presents: Ateo Buhne’s Car accident, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Ateo Buhne teams up with an amazing team to team up to go on an amazing journey to experience ateos car accident in musical form.

An experience not to miss! There will also be pieces of my wrecked proton saga for sale.

Featuring: Ateo Buhne , Nico Buhne, Lorenzo Buhne, Jack Harris. With guests: Isaac Randel and Miro “the general” Holland.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: DADS at the Undercurrent!, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

The Dancing And Drinking Society have been bringing their swing blues sounds to dance floors and craft beer bars across the capital since late 1913. When they take to the stage, guitar, horns, vocals, and kick drum blend as The Society present their favourite old rarities with exactly the sort of vigour you want for some stress relieving dance times. They’ve cultivated a decent reputation for generous and open-hearted live performance. If you feel like a decent drink and a leg shake or two, this would make for a pretty good option.

With Mat Enright, Adrian Jensen, Daniel Yeabsley, Blair Latham.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Daniel Harris Quartet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Be prepared for a relaxing evening of traditional jazz music!

Hailing from the (not so) distant city of Christchurch, Daniel and Zachary are joined by locals Ferdinand and Oscar to deliver a wonderful blend of relaxing jazz classics. Featuring quintessential songs from the jazz age, you can rely on a wonderful evening to wash away the worries of the 21st century.

The modern jazz style often incorporates many harsher elements in order to stand out, which can be very engaging. But it often demands attention, and radiates a tense atmosphere. Vintage jazz tends to prioritize an easy listening experience, with lyrical melodies and traditional music harmony.

Settle into a chair, take a sip of wine, and let the smooth harmonies flow over you!

Featuring:

Piano: Daniel Harris
Trombone: Ferdinand Hitchings-Anstice
Bass: Zachary Chyr
Drums: Oscar Garvie
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Emy and the Car Crash, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Hailing from the mega-city of Fielding, intergalactically renowned musician, Car Crash Emy is back!


After gracing the prestigious stage of The Stomach during her Palmy-wide tour with teenage heavy metal band, Pagan Love Song, Emy is switching genre again.


Join her as she covers super-niche underground artists, such as Ella Fitzgerald and Nina Simone.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Free Status, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Free Status is a jazz fusion band, drawing melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.

At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can't wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.

The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand's jazz greats.

On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.

On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America's Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.

On vocals is Melody Lui-Webster, an award-winning singer and accomplished musical theatre performer and actor, with numerous professional stage and television roles.

Thank you for watching!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Greer Castle and Tim Honiss, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Step into a world of timeless elegance and smoky charm with this late-night jazz duet, featuring sultry vocals and masterful piano. Specialising in swing standards and heartfelt ballads, the duo brings the golden age of jazz to life with intimate interpretations and sophisticated flair.

Their setlist weaves through the Great American Songbook—think Ella Fitzgerald, Nat King Cole, Billie Holiday, and Frank Sinatra—delivering classic tunes with warmth, nuance, and a fresh personal touch.

Featuring Greer Castle and Tim Honiss.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: John Rae’s BOP-IT!, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

John Rae’s BOP-IT! Hard Bop with a Kiwi Twist.

Featuring a stellar lineup of Aotearoa’s finest jazz musicians, John
Rae’s BOP-IT! delivers a high-energy celebration of the hard bop era.
Rooted in the rich traditions of 1950s and 60s jazz, BOP-IT! brings new
life to classic repertoire while exploring the bold, boundary-pushing
spirit of post-bop.

With virtuosic solos, driving rhythms, and deep grooves, this will be
one of the most exhilarating performances of the festival. Hard bop has
always challenged both audiences and musicians alike—and BOP-IT! takes
it to the next level.

Featuring: John Rae Drums, Ben Wilcock Piano, Patrick Bleakley Bass, Oscar Laven Sax, Michael Taylor Trumpet.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Liam's And Ferd's Double Trombone Extravaganza, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

A blazing tribute to the golden age of jazz trombone quintets!

Join us for an unforgettable night as two powerhouse trombonists take the stage, backed by a red-hot rhythm section. This high-energy performance celebrates the timeless sounds of jazz legends J.J. Johnson, Kai Winding, Al Grey, and modern masters Steve Davis and Elliot Mason.

Featuring:
Liam George & Ferdinand Hitchings-Anstice – Trombones
Liam Reburn – Guitar
Jacob Hurst – Bass
Oscar Garvie – Drums
Special Guest: Daniel Yeabsley – Saxophone Giant

Expect an electrifying evening of hard-swinging grooves, smooth ballads, and bold, double-trombone brilliance – all brought to life by some of Wellington’s finest young jazz talents.

Whether you're a jazz aficionado or just love a good groove, this is a night you won't want to miss.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Lockie Bennett + 4, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Lockie Bennett + 4' is a quintet, led by Lockie Bennett, comprising some of New Zealand and Australia’s leading musicians. The quintet will be making its debut performance at The Undercurrent for the 2025 Wellington Jazz Festival. This is likely to be your only chance to catch this band in the flesh for some time. Expect to hear arrangments of songs by the great Elmo Hope, Tadd Dameron, Bud Powell and many more.

Featuring: Lockie Bennett (guitar), Mike Costeloe (trumpet), Alex Trask (saxophone), Elijah Mulheron (bass), Tim Geldens (drums)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Luca Ciarla solOrkestra, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Luca Ciarla redraws the borders of jazz violin with a loop pedal, his voice and a wise use of electronics. He performs the entire score of his band solo, playing the violin also like a guitar, a cello or a percussion instrument.

In this imaginative musical landscape Luca sings, whistles, plays other instruments or adds new improvisations; music is continuously evolving into a dazzling solOrkestra.

The program Jazz Violin 2.0 features original compositions and unusual arrangements of jazz standards.

“…his post-Coltrane approach to ‘My Favorite Things’ was a clever way to twit a jazz classic…” The San Francisco Examiner (Usa)

Featuring LUCA CIARLA on violin, vocals, live loops and electronics
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Miro Holland's Ordinance Group, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

After a successful July undercurrent debut, Miro Holland returns -bringing with him stand up locals; Isaac Randel, Evie Patterson, Ateo and Nico Buhne- all brimming with talent. The recent cold months enraging Miro's spirit, he has returned to the light to present his new thinking. The ordinance is about stopping the nullifying wishwash, and getting everyone back to listening to each other! We will swing, dance, we will blow that's sure. There is a tendency for fiction in art that goes often ignored here, but not today! It will be bold and hopefully we will all (you included) be talking to each other, before, after, and during the gig. I think everyone in the band has lots to say and it would be a bummer if you missed out. Come!

Musicians: Miro Holland, Evie Patterson, Ateo Buhne, Nico Buhne and Isaac Randel.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Queens of the Blues, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Bye bye Gatsby! Ali Affleck is celebrating 30 years of pioneering blues and hokum (1913-1933).

Award-winning vocalist (& jazz historian) with an local kiwi musicians join forces to Celebrate the brave and bawdy blues queens who reigned in the prohibition era - many sadly forgotten over time.

'The music was bold – the women even more so! 'Masterclass in grassroots jazz/blues' ***** (Edinburgh49.org).

'Not a household name yet – she soon will be' (BBC Jazzhouse).

‘Vivacious’ (Herald).

Six-time nominee for Best Vocalist (Scottish Jazz Awards)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: Stable Mates Sextet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Auckland based jazz ensemble Stable Mates Sextet performs a selection of original compositions inspired by an array of influences, ranging from Wayne Shorter and Pharoah Sanders to Michael Brecker and Chris Potter. Having performed together regularly fronted by individual bandleaders in the past, the Stable Mates Sextet now joins forces as a collaborative group ready to share new works, and new interpretations of old works.

Featuring:

Charlotte Barrand - Alto Saxophone

Felix Hayes-Tourelle - Tenor Saxophone

Robin Baek - Guitar

Connor McAneny - Piano

Wil Goodinson - Bass

TBC - Guest Drummer
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: The Enigma, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Get ready for a sonic journey like no other as The Enigma takes the stage at this year’s Jazz Festival! This electrifying organ jazz trio is known for their thrilling original compositions and high-octane performances that keep audiences on the edge of their seats. Featuring Miles Crayford on the mighty Hammond organ, Mike Jensen driving the rhythm on drums, and Aleister Campbell weaving masterful guitar lines, The Enigma delivers a sound that’s both deeply rooted in jazz tradition and fearlessly experimental.

Expect the unexpected—this trio thrives on spontaneity, with compositions that twist, turn, and evolve in real time. Each performance is a living, breathing moment of musical exploration, bursting with energy, groove, and emotional depth. Whether it’s a deep-pocket groove or an explosive burst of improvisation, The Enigma creates music that’s alive with tension, playfulness, and dynamic contrast.

Don’t miss your chance to witness one of the most captivating acts on the scene. The Enigma isn't just a band—it's an experience. Catch them live and be a part of the mystery.

Featuring: Miles Crayford - Organ, Aleister Campbell - Guitar, Mike Jensen - Drums.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Festival: The Iggy Nama Ruci Quartet, An exclusive concert for Wellington Jazz Festival at The Undercurrent.

Led by Auckland saxophonist, Iggy Nama Ruci, the Iggy Nama Ruci quartet features a powerful interplay of musical conversation through the medium of straight-ahead jazz.

After recently touring around India and South Africa, surrounded by a plethora of Gospel jazz musicians, Iggy brings a fresh perspective and an open playfulness to the bandstand.

Michael Nash, fine-tuned Auckland pianist, draws inspiration from the likes of Brad Meldhau and Keith Jarrett, providing versatile and expressive approach to improvisation.

On double bass, Tyler Diprose acts as a grounding force, laying down a foundation, while providing rich musical intuition and connection in conversation with the band.

Max Crook brings a fiery finesse controlled by creativity and elegance to the drums. His attention to listening and reacting to the band demands constant interactive conversation.

The group will play a range of tunes from original compositions to standards by Thelonius Monk and Lennie Tristano.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Callum Allardice, The eleventh concert in our series of Aotearoa jazz composers features award winning composer and performer Callum Allardice, with a new suite of music for rhythm section and strings; Ode to Sadness.
A collection of songs, old and new, presented alongside some of the works that inspired them. From intimate improvisations and poignant melodies to soaring strings, the music moves through moments of reverence, reflection, and quiet triumph. Sometimes solemn, sometimes radiant, but always beautiful, Ode To Sadness is a celebration of the beauty found in sorrow.

Callum is an award-winning composer and guitarist based in New Zealand. He is a three-time recipient of the APRA Best Jazz Composition award for his works ‘Sons of Thunder’ (2016), ‘Deep Thought’ (2017), and ‘Chungin’ (2019). In 2020 he and his group The Jac, received the Recorded Music NZ Best Jazz Artist award for their album ‘A Gathering’, and in 2022 he was the inaugural Te Kōkī - New Zealand School of Music jazz composer-in-residence.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.
Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson.

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.

This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude

Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: John Rae, Award-winning composer and musician John Rae invites you to an
enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.
John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.

description:
Jess Deacon at Waterfront, Jess Deacon at Waterfront
Saturday evening vibes with singer/songwriter Jess Deacon. Playing some re-imagined covers and original songs, Jess’s love of jazz, folk and classic rock shines through in her music, delivered with a punch and a side of sass!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.

She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.

Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.

Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.

Tickets $20 or $10 for Capital Blues Inc members.

description:
Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.
She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.
Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.
Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.

Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.

description:
Kids Rock 4 Palestine, Kids Rock For Palestine
One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.
Do you want to volunteer to help? Email aotearoa2gaza@gmail.com
ALL UNDER 18s MUST ATTEND WITH A PARENT OR GUARDIAN.
Can’t make it? Donate anyway!

If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.

description:
Lacuna Presents - Us Two tickets, Presented by: Lacuna
Us Two is a high-energy house DJ act from the Midlands, UK, with releases on some of the world's most respected labels including Knee Deep In Sound, MicroHertz, and Eastenderz. Known for deep grooves, rolling basslines, and infectious crowd connection, Us Two has earned support from global heavyweights like Marco Carola, Jamie Jones, and Skream.
From European festival stages to Ibiza's 528 for a standout set with Knee Deep In Sound, Us Two's sound blends underground credibility with dancefloor-ready energy.
His latest release, "Simulation" (featuring Franksy), drops on Pete Tong's TSZR label, and has already earned plays from tastemakers like ANOTR, SG Lewis, LF SYSTEM, and SOSA, with early reactions going wild at Music On (Pacha Ibiza) and beyond.
For Lacuna, hosting Us Two’s debut in Wellington is about more than a headline — it's personal. We're thrilled to finally bring a dear friend's sound to our city and invite you to feel the energy first-hand on Saturday, 20 September 2025, at Meow Nui.
Packages

description:
Li'l Chuck @ The Shed, Li'l Chuck @ The Shed
Li’l Chuck is heading North for the first time in a number of years - since opening for Jimmy Buffet at The Wellington Opera House and is excited to play his first ever shows in Lower Hutt, Whanganui and the Taranaki region. He’ll be celebrating 10 years since his acclaimed album release ‘Blues in Full swing’ and the recent release of his new single ‘Gumption’

Li’l Chuck will present his full one man band plus a selection of his cranky home made instruments and Diddley bows and offering audiences the amazing opportunity to jam, skiffle and learn about his old time homemade music.

Having spent a lifetime rummaging through the drawers of 1930's - 50's music, Chuck’s songs are inspired by the sounds of the era - Blues, Early Jazz, Western Swing, Ragtime etc. and are uniquely presented in the style of street performers from those glory days. Sticking to the traditional one man band format, Chuck plays all the instruments simultaneously.
Captivating storytelling intertwines effortlessly with heart stopping harmonica. Multiple guitar styles are underpinned by his left and right feet frantically pounding the kick and hi hat. The listener is left simply wondering, "How the hell does he do that"?
Originally hailing from the UK, Li’l Chuck has been stomping his music in NZ since 2003.
Li'l Chuck has performed at many high profile events around New Zealand including opening for American legend Jimmy Buffet, Bluesman Jerron 'Blind Boy' Paxton and The Topp Twins, and festivals including Blues on Broadbeach, Gold Coast Australia, Dunedin and Wanaka Arts festivals, The Great Kiwi Beer festival, Canterbury folk festival and many more.
Up to 2025, He has recorded 5 solo one man band records to great acclaim by international Blues publications.
His 2017 album Utility Blues hit No’6 on the official NZ albums chart & has twice been the feature artist on Jesse Mulligan's Radio New Zealand’s Friday live.
In an age where we are rushing around at breakneck speed, where everything is instant, sugar coated, airbrushed and overly polished, Li’l Chuck brings us down to earth with some organic, all natural, whole grain, naked goodness.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Liam Cooper’s King of the Keys, He’s a modern-day piano man singing the songs of famous piano men. Australian Liam Cooper intends to thrill an audience at The Opera House with a concert of famous songs. In Liam Cooper’s show King of the Keys, the entertainer will celebrate the music of Elton John, Peter Allen, Billy Joel, Stevie Wonder, Freddie Mercury, Ray Charles, and more. A killer live band will help him negotiate a nostalgic catalogue of 40 classic songs from 15 musical legends. 
Along with faithful renditions of many songs, Liam will captivate you with the stories behind them. Learn about who Paul McCartney wrote ‘Let It Be’ for, and what Elton John’s ‘Bennie & The Jets’ satirises. You’ll get a new appreciation for the songs that have become anthems for generations. 
In a final twist, the audience gets to choose how the show ends. You’ll be able to use your phone to vote live in the theatre. Decide who is the one true ‘King of the Keys’ to influence the show’s unique conclusion.
