description:
Lord Rochester - Scotland's Greatest Rock And Roll Band, CLEAN DiRT & Under the radar present ......

SCOTTISH ROCK AND ROLLERS - LORD ROCHESTER

AOTEAROA TOUR October 2025

In keeping with great Rock & Roll, Lord Rochester embrace the simplicity of sound and song using the maraca powered shuffle of artists such as Bo Diddley, Chuck Berry and Jimmy Reed to create stripped back, rhythm driven, rock and roll. A three piece combo that includes Russell Wilkins (The Milkshakes, The Delmonas, The Len Bright Combo and The Wildebeests) on Gretsch Electromatic Guitar (yes – the red rectangle!), Vocals and Harmonica and Saskia Holling (Sally Skull, The Nettelles and Thee Girl Fridays) on Bass and Vocals. Scotland’s best sounding (and best looking) rock and roll show have toured Japan, Australia (twice!) and Mexico, and played all over Europe and the UK. They have toured their native Scotland from the Borders to Aberdeenshire and from the Central Belt to the Highlands and not forgetting the Shetland Islands. Always entertaining and forever stylish, the band can bewitch an audience, large or small. Lord Rochester has performed live in session for the BBC, recorded at the famous Perrotti Studios in Gijon, Spain and provide the theme music for the ’Vic Galloway Show’ on BBC Radio Scotland. This October they venture to the far reaches of New Zealand ....

Local supports to be announced in the south island

Opening the shows in the North Island will be the one man band explosion simply known as Dirtbag!

October 2025 - Thursday 16th Petone at Abandoned Taproom

description:
Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.

Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.

Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).

Dust off those vintage finds, raid the costume box, slip into something that sparkles, or create a look that defies gravity and convention. The wilder, the better! Or just bring your fabulous unadorned self.

description:
Lucid Dreamin', Lucid Dreamin’ with Camp Low Expectations 🌜
Step beyond the veil and into the realm of lucid dreaming, where sound becomes sensation, and movement becomes vibration  🌪️
Camp Low Expectations invites you to drift through an immersive night of sonic exploration, guiding dreamers and dancers alike with deep grooves, hypnotic rhythms, and bass-heavy journeys.
⚡ Set Times ⚡
8:00pm - Bababear (House)
9:00pm - ZipZap (Tribal Progressive)
10:00pm - Queenie (Tribal Techno & Psy)
11:00pm - 93silva (Experimental Techno)
12:00am - Dexi (Primal Bass)
Dress to theme and step into the dreamscape. Think otherworldly, strange, or surreal. Express your dream-self and let your outfit become part of the collective vision.
Special thanks to ZipZap for lighting, Gold for Gold (Blair & Fortuna) for the sound system, Chelsea for her graphic design, and Ruby speciosa var. Photography, who will be capturing the night through her lens 📷
Camp Low Expectation values enthusiastic consent. We have zero tolerance for anti-social behaviour, if you or someone else needs support, please reach out to the nearest camp member.
Photos and videos will be taken through the night, please let us know if you prefer not to be involved.
As always, resect each other, the venue, and most of all.. have fun! 💞
All proceeds help bring Camp Low Expectation’s vision to life at Kiwiburn 2026 🌞

description:
MESH IX RETURN - LILA TIRANDO A VIOLETA, MESH began in 2018 as a queer collective looking to provide a playful space for live experimentation in Te Whanganui a Tara. We’ve finally heeded the call to bring it back to life and are beyond excited to host none other than sonic innovator Lila Tirando a Violeta.
With an extensive and varied output including releases for hallowed labels such as Hyperdub and N.A.A.F.I, Lila has been dubbed “one of the greats of modern electronic music.” As explained in a review of her most recent album Dream of Snakes, “her ability to traverse ambient, industrial, psychedelia, bass, and club music, as well as the various rhythms of her native Uruguay without ever tripping up on any one of them rates somewhere well beyond impressive.”
Lila will be joined by local artists Juniper May, Kolya and TOČKA for a night of all live sets, plus a spatial audio intervention by Metaxis. As always, please remember to respect the space and the people you share it with. This means being mindful of how you contribute to the collective experience and how your actions might impact those around you.
Feel free to send us a message on instagram if you have any questions. See you there x
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MESSIE - Wellington, MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
label: Music & Concerts

Singer-songwriter Maddy Low performs original songs, acoustic-pop, indie-folk/rock, layered vocals, intricate guitar and quietly powerful songwriting.
Honest, intimate songs that leave a mark.

Listen here: ⁦https://www.youtube.com/@maddylmusic⁩

Maddy will be joined by supporting acts Lucy Summerfield and PEBBLE.

Lucy Summerfield is an 18-year-old singer-songwriter from Te Tauihu, now living in Wellington. She writes in both te Reo Māori and English. At The Undercurrent she will be performing original songs with cello accompaniment.

PEBBLE is an indie folk-pop artist, songwriter and traveler, often based in Aotearoa. For the last 2 years, he has travelled through Asia, Europe and Latin America, creating and releasing songs in every country he has been.

description:
Mallrat | Wellington (SOLD OUT), Australian indie pop princess Mallrat will return to New Zealand this September on the Light Hit My Face Like a Straight Right World Tour, following a run of sold out shows across Europe and USA.
Sophomore album Light Hit My Face Like A Straight brings dance music that has heart and potent magic which will be manifested into life on stage, alongside all your favourite Mallrat hits and accompanied by her incredible live band.
The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.
Joining Mallrat on her New Zealand headline shows is none other than Aotearoa’s own indie pop darling, Riiki Reid — bringing her signature style and infectious energy to the stage for an unforgettable night of music.

Vagabond.

Rooted in the rich cultural traditions of northeast Brazil, this vibrant collective of musicians and vocalists honours the powerful percussion and soulful songs created by past generations. Maracatui has evolved over the years, blending traditional sounds with original compositions and modern production techniques to create a sound that's both authentic and new.

Known for their infectious energy, Maracatui's performances are an irresistible invitation for audience participation. Their unique blend of powerful beats and beautiful melodies creates a communal experience that will leave you feeling uplifted.

And to be honest, the beer is also stellar! We love Rogue!

Music from 9:30

description:
Messie, AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND (Jul 1, 2025) – Wellington-based DJ phenomenon MESSIE, aka Tessa Hills has today announced two All Night Long DJ sets across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau. Gaining international attention after opening for one of the United Kingdom’s most coveted DJs Fred again.. and remixing his song ‘places to be’ which now has over 2.6M listens on Spotify alone, MESSIE is quickly becoming one of the most exciting new names to watch in New Zealand.
Audiences will be able to enjoy MESSIE’s high-energy, electrifying set for literally the entire night - with these two shows running until the early hours of the morning. Saturday, September 13th will see her take over Auckland’s Studio the Venue, before heading to Wellington’s San Fran the following Saturday, September 20th.
Tickets for MESSIE’s All Night Long tour in Auckland and Wellington will be available to purchase by the General Public on Friday 4th July at 12:00pm.
My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences Wednesday 2nd July from 11:00am until Friday 4th July at 11:00am. Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz.
MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.
Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music internationally to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
MESSIE
ALL NIGHT LONG TOUR Presented by Live Nation

description:
Monteverdi Vespers (Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610), Join award-winning choir The Tudor Consort for our major project of the year! This will be the first time this groundbreaking work has been performed in Wellington for over a decade.


Juxtaposing Renaissance melodies and polyphony with the rich virtuosity and colour of Baroque instruments, intimate vocal solos with a choir and orchestra of unprecedented grandeur, and dazzling opulence with striking emotional and spiritual depth, this will be an unmissable performance



We are thrilled to be joined by an incredible orchestra of top musicians from the NZSO and leading international artists! Come hear the striking tones of cornetti, dulcian, archlutes, Baroque recorders and more!



N.B. There will be a pre-concert talk at 7pm.

description:
Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes- Parisian Swing Trio, Get ready for a night of irresistible rhythm and sizzling jazz!

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are "Les Tripes" (french for "The Guts") ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

Book now to join us for a French inspired Set Menu from 5.30pm (served in one of our dining rooms) before moving out to the show.
2 courses $55.
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL.
Email reservations@thistleinn.co.nz to book.

description:
NZSM Big Band Showcase, Witness the hard-swinging Big Band One from the Te Kōkī New Zealand School Of Music Performance Programme.

The NZSM Big Band is one of the flagship performance ensembles for the jazz programme and plays regularly throughout New Zealand.

Led by Daniel Hayles, the band shows off the next generation of Pōneke jazz talent in a signature swinging, brassy, high-energy style. Expect music from COunt Basie, Steely Dan, Mingus, Peggy Lee, Raye, and many more. Join us for a night of multi-genre celebration, from swing-era gems to modern classics.

Students from all year groups join for a night of classic swing, hard bop, funk and fusion styles in a large ensemble format under the direction of Eilish Wilson, Oscar Lavën and Daniel Hayles.

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

description:
NZTrio presents Fantastique, Renowned classical music ensemble NZTrio He Taonga Wairere present their extraordinary programme Fantastique.
Described as a "national treasure" and "New Zealand's most indispensable ensemble" (William Dart, NZ Herald), NZTrio combines warm kiwi stage presence with musicians at the top of their craft.
Amalia Hall (violin), Somi Kim (piano) and Callum Hall (guest cello) explore a lavish tapestry of styles and emotions in Fantastique, a programme of contrasts. Turina's Circulo depicts a single day through dawn, midday and dusk, while brooding disquiet meets stark intensity in Shostakovich's Piano Trio No.1 in C minor. Chen Yi's Tibetan Tunes creates a fusion of traditional Tibetan melodies referencing Buddhist god Du Mu, before the premiere of Angelus, a new commission by one of Aotearoa’s most acclaimed composers, John Psathas. Finally, Franck's youthful Piano Trio No. 1 in F sharp minor is as charming and intimate as it is powerful and explosive.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

This is your chance to see their first full-length concert performance of 2025!

“The repertoire we sing in this choir is so diverse and fresh. It’s not choral music as you’d expect. The choir is one of the best sounding in Aotearoa, and we have so much fun performing the pieces. Anyone who sings in choirs or just for fun as a hobby should come and hear us perform”– 2023-24 NZSSC singer

Bring the whole family for an evening of choral excellence and entertainment!

Get your early bird special before 29 August 2025 to secure a great concert at a great bargain!

description:
Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour, Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Niels and the Cartertones in concert, DATE: Friday Sept 26
TIME: 7pm
LOCATION: The Offering – 65 Main St, Greytown
AGES:
COST: $25 pp at the door, bookings essential by txt to 02102361951 or booking link below. Max capacity 60
A collaboration between four extraordinary, Wairarapa-based musicians for a special concert, covering many of Leonard Cohen’s best-loved pieces. This concert is an alliance between:
Niels Gedge, fingerstyle guitar and lead vocals, is a well-known singer-songwriter on the folk scene, with two albums of original songs. He has also performed extensively in cafes and bars and at events in the UK and throughout NZ. Niels’s vocal range is very similar to that of Leonard Cohen.
Kate Marshall, multi-instrumentalist and vocals. As well as singing in a duo with her partner Bob Cooper-Grundy at clubs, pubs and festivals, Kate is a key member of the much-loved Raven Mavens, the all-woman Boogie/Blues band that plays regularly around the Wellington Region, and beyond. Bob is an Americana/blues musician who plays finger-picking guitar, mandolin, and slide guitar. Bob has opened for Americana Greats: Guy Clark, Townes van Zandt, Tom Russell, and Jimmy LaFave.
Steve Trotman, vocals and acoustic guitar. Inspired by the bands of the 1950s and 1960s, as well as singer-songwriters such as James Taylor and Paul Simon, Steve fronted various Wellington groups in the 1970s before heading overseas. He co-founded Verandah Band in the early 2000s, playing a mix of genres in every Wairarapa venue (and beyond) for the past 20-odd years, including Toast Martinborough and Summer Hummer.
Book your tickets here: https://greytownarttown.com/neilsandthecartertones/

description:
Nui Hui 7, Nui Hui 7
NUI HUI 7 – LIVE AT 14 WAIU STREET
Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
Saturday 22 November 2025 | 4PM – LATE

Nui Hui is back – louder, prouder, and more unfiltered than ever. This grassroots music series is built for the people, by the people, shining a spotlight on bands who grind it out, carve their own paths, and keep live music alive.

Nui Hui 7 is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge, and soul against a true blue-collared backdrop. No industry machines, no corporate gloss – just raw, rising talent backed by the passion of locals and volunteers who believe in the power of music.

This year’s lineup is stacked with unsigned and upcoming artists from across the region and beyond:

4PM – Munkiez

With a sound as cheeky and chaotic as their name suggests, MUNKIEZ is a bluesy, funk-rock explosion that proves good times and great grooves go hand-in-hand. Hailing from Upper Hutt, this crew is all about embracing the raw energy of rock and roll while slathering on a thick coat of soulful, slinky funk.
They're not here to reinvent the wheel, but to make it spin faster, dirtier, and with a whole lot more swagger. With a dash of that no-nonsense, straight-outta-the-garage Kiwi attitude. MUNKIEZ are a band you feel in your bones, a sound that gets your head nodding and your feet moving before you even realize what's happening. They play it like they mean it, because they do.

5PM – The Groundsmen

Scott Paddock and Shane Martin formed The Groundsmen back in the heady days of 2017 and went through various drummers and bass players before finally finding stability with drummer Rowan Carlyle in 2018.

Since then they’ve played numerous gigs (one supporting Head Like A Hole in Gisborne at Smash Palace 30th anniversary) and released 3 singles on Spotify and other streaming platforms - Black Car, Supanova and Achtung Baby (check them out!).

They’ve recorded their debut album and are just about to mix it and release it.

Playing only original earthen rock punk, we always, always, perform at 110% energy levels and put on a great show with hooky uptempo toons!! With songs commenting on contemporary society and life at large all 3 members throw themselves fully into their performance and leave no energy unused. You will leave one of their shows changed.

See the excerpt from a review of a in Whanganui July 2020:

“After a quick change of equipment, The Groundsmen were next on the agenda. Proclaiming themselves to be Taranaki’s premier rock punk band, the trio wasted no time in belting out a hard and fast set of original, classic punk-inspired tunes that were lapped up by the growing gathering of punters. Bass player Scott Paddock is a tour-de-force; full of noise, energy and an appropriate rock-punk swagger. Along with guitarist Shane Martin and drummer Rowan Carlyle, The Groundsmen powered their way though and energetic set, and it was immediately evident that they were ecstatic to be back on stage and performing again after the recent enforced hiatus. The trio powered through a set of classic, no-frills, original punk inspired tracks that had almost everyone in the room either on their feet or gyrating in their seats. Definitely a crowd-pleaser, there is no doubt whatsoever that The Groundsmen were in their element, and clearly love what they do.”

….from Ambient Light, author Bridget Herlihy, 4th July 2020

6PM – Kaletta Band

Kaletta is a Latin rock band that brings together the rhythms of ska punk and gypsy sounds in Spanish. With musicians from Chile, Colombia, Argentina, Italy, the UK, and New Zealand, our sound is a blend of different beats and roots. We've had the privilege of being two-time national finalists in the Battle of the Bands (BOTB 2024 and 2025) and have performed at festivals like Island Bay and toured the top South Island. We're excited about our upcoming tours in New Zealand next year.

What we're passionate about is creating music that's true to ourselves. Each song is a journey, moving from calm to energetic moments that we hope will keep you engaged. Our lyrics touch on social and political themes, and we hope our performances will inspire thought and conversation. We're looking forward to sharing our music with you and creating memorable experiences through our dynamic sound and energy.

7PM – Burning Embers

Accustomed to breaching anything that requires sociable etiquette they still manage to pull off their unique brand of Wainuiomata rock.

From out of nowhere, they regroup, drink a few, set a plan, and do the complete opposite in tasteful fashion. Burning Embers have an uncanny habit of pulling off a great set, usually unscripted but full of the essence that is Rock n Roll. We're not here long enough to care, but we do love a great audience
Reminiscent of Days of the New and Alice in Chains they're definitely genuine entertainment

8PM – Stretch to Mould

Stretch to Mould is a rock band from Wellington New Zealand who formed in 2012. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Darrell Vickers, who has been the only constant member throughout multiple line up changes. Since 2024 the line up has consisted of Vickers alongside Chris Fursdon (bass guitar) and Thomas Fuller (Drums). Stretch to Mould are known for their high energy, hard hitting riffs, powerful vocals and all-round solid musicianship. The band released their debut album Shadows in 2012, EP Painting Faces in 2014 and are currently working on their next release.

9PM – Ras Judah and the Culture Embassy

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

10PM – The Fabulous Pakehas

Were first conceived in London England, way back in the early 90s whilst on O.E's. Currently working on a album, & after 33 years, still in no rush.
With two of us having roots in WOA TFP are honoured to be playing a set of our originals for NUI HUI 7
The T.F.P original line up are, Antony Maddock, Scott McGill, Leslie Tearne, &
Bevan Ritchie.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From soul-stirring grooves to fist-in-the-air anthems, Nui Hui 7 is more than just a gig – it’s a celebration of musicians who hustle, create, and share their art on their own terms.

Nui Hui: supporting local, celebrating original, and keeping the fire of live music burning
label: Music & Concerts

description:
O Fortuna!, Prepare for a night of musical grandeur as Orpheus Choir Wellington and Auckland Choral, New Zealand’s largest city choirs, unite to present Orff’s monumental Carmina Burana! With its apocalyptic opening, O Fortuna, this masterpiece explores the capricious nature of fate, the joys and sorrows of life, and the boundless energy of human passion. From the revelry of In Taberna to the tender beauty of Dulcissime, Carmina Burana is a visceral and unforgettable experience.

The concert opens with Bernstein’s radiant Chichester Psalms, a joyous blend of rhythmic vitality and heartfelt spirituality, providing the perfect prelude to the drama and intensity of Orff’s masterpiece. Both works will feature acclaimed pianists Jian Liu and Diedre Irons in little known arrangements

This performance will be mighty in sheer scale, with nearly 300 performers on stage, including a children’s chorus, the combined power of two elite choirs, and the dynamic sound of the Wellington Brass Band. Add to this the extraordinary talents of soloists Emma Pearson (soprano), Stephen ("Coco") Diaz (tenor), and James Harrison (baritone), and you have a musical event of epic proportions.

description:
Original Sin (UK) | Wellington, FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON

The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.

With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.

This one’s gonna be nasty. Backing him up is a stacked local roster, keeping the energy high from doors to close:

Molly (AKL) & Gusty
Procy (TIU) & Nos (TGA) + HP
Storm & Scholten
Freeman x Chano
Dkav
Stems

––––––––––––––––––

Welly… brace yourself.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Other Futures Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is about multi-disciplinary excellence and celebration of our individual and collective voices in new ways. In this episode, anticipate steaming and reverent swing alongside triumphant soul, dark and scenic textures, and dripped-out golden-age hip-hop cuts. We celebrate artistry with dignity, respect and above all, joy. We swing hard. We groove like humanity depends on it. Groove with us at Meow Nui this Wellington Jazz Festival!
=========
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is where musical dreams come alive. It’s about the spark of true individuality, nestled in the art and community of ensemble. The thrill and drama of the showband era re-envisioned for our time. Selections that signify deeper meanings and secret codes. Turntablism sensibility on a symphonic scale. Streamlined, momentous, nimble, angular, adapting, shape-shifting, pulsating with relentless joy and emotion.
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is an ongoing project by Daniel Hayles that looks to honour elements of the big band tradition while platforming music and artists unexplored within the style. Expect to hear distinct flavour in new interpretations of original music from Aotearoa and the world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
POP Go the Festival Singers: Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Church, The Festival Singers invite you to a enjoy unforgettable music in POP go the Festival Singers – a dazzling celebration of popular songs from the 1920s right through to today. Expect energy, variety, and entertainment as we journey through swing, rock ’n’ roll, Motown, disco, soft rock, and contemporary pop.
The programme sparkles with classics and favourites: a Beach Boys Medley full of surfside sunshine, Ruru Karaitiana’s iconic Blue Smoke, Elvis Presley’s Hound Dog, and Bobby Darin’s Beyond the Sea. We’ll groove with Pharrell Williams’ Happy, cheer to Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger, and celebrate Kiwi pride in Crowded House’s Weather with You. Heartfelt beauty shines through Simon and Garfunkel’s Bridge Over Troubled Water and Billy Joel’s And So It Goes, while fun abounds with The Lion Sleeps Tonight and Gershwin’s sultry Summertime.
Swing makes its mark with Glenn Miller’s Chattanooga Choo Choo and In the Mood, while a rousing Queen Medley and an exuberant ABBA Medley bring the concert to a thrilling close. Along the way, enjoy contemporary sparkle with Dua Lipa’s Levitating and the timeless artistry of these unforgettable hits.
With the incomparable Jonathan Berkahn at the piano, every piece shines with character and style. This concert promises nostalgia, joy, and toe-tapping fun – a true trip down memory lane with something for everyone.
Join us and be part of a celebration of music that entertains, connects, and uplifts.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Paul Ubana Jones Plays The Shed, He’s back!
Doors open 7.30pm for an 8PM start.
Don’t miss Paul up close and personal in this intimate 35 seat venue.
An intimate soulful performer, an acoustic guitar sensation, winner of three New Zealand Music Awards.
Paul has shared the stage and toured with the best: BB King, Bob Dylan, Taj Mahal, Keb Mo, Crowded House, Tuck and Patti… He has delighted festival audiences at the Dublin Blues Festival, Byron bay Blues festival, Vancouver Island Folk Festival, Blues at Bridgetown and many others in Europe.
“A national treasure; Paul Ubana Jones is so much more than one man with a guitar. He is a conjuror of unique and original songs, rooted in primal Blues and Soul”
“The most exciting Electro Acoustic Artist to visit our shores”
Good Morning News, Santa Monica
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Peter Hook and The Light, Bassist Peter Hook has intimate knowledge of the music of bands Joy Division and New Order. He’s one of the founding members of both British new wave bands. In July 2026, he is bringing his band The Light to The Opera House in Wellington. Together they will perform New Order’s album ‘Get Ready’ in full to celebrate its 25th anniversary. To make the concert even better, they will also perform a selection of greatest hits from Joy Division’s and New Order’s back catalogue. Get ready to enjoy songs like Disorder, Shadowplay, Transmission, Love Will Tear Us Apart, Blue Monday, and True Faith. 
The dark and ethereal sound of Joy Division and New Order ushered in the post-punk era and continue to be influential in the rock music scene. Peter Hook and The Light are careful to meticulously recreate their music in a live setting. Audiences are in for a show where treasured songs are played with the passion and energy they deserve.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pig Destroyer + Glassblower + Post Natal Abortion- Wellington - San Fran, PIG DESTROYER Australian & New Zealand Tour
September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only
Sept 2nd – Perth, Amplifier Bar w/ Bile Cannon, Allocer*
Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard
Sept 5th – Melbourne, Max Watts w/ Tongue Scum
Sept 6th – Sydney, The Factory Theatre w/ Crown Street Militia
Sept 7th – Canberra, The Baso w/ Blight Worms
Sept 9th – Brisbane, The Triffid w/ Awful Noise
Sept 10th – Townsville, The Warehouse w/ Varrim*
Sept 12th – Auckland, Galatos w/ Imperial Slave, Sawnoff*
Sept 13th – Christchurch, Loons w/ Vixen Execution, Unyielding Desolation*
Sept 14th – Wellington, San Fran w/ Glassblower, Post Natal Abortion*
*Wormrot not appearing in Perth, Townsville or NZ
TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.
Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.
www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer

www.facebook.com/wormrot

www.swdpresents.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pipe Band Centenary Dinner, Join us as we celebrate 100 years of the Scots College Pipe Band at a Centenary Dinner on 20 September 2025! This milestone event promises to be filled with nostalgia, reconnections, and memories with old and current friends. 
There are two parts to this exciting event: the Pipe Band Reunion Rehearsal, and the Pipe Band Centenary Dinner.
Pipe Band Reunion Rehearsal
On 20 September at 2pm, we invite all past and present band members to gather for a get together and a rehearsal. The music that we will rehearse at this session will be played at the Centenary Dinner, and this event will conclude around 4:30pm.
Pipe Band Centenary Dinner
We invite you to our very special Pipe Band Centenary Dinner starting at 7pm in the Scots College Hall, which includes Guest Speaker Sir Ashley Bloomfield, performances by past and present Band members, a Haggis ceremony, and reflections on 100 years of the Pipe Band at Scots College.
We look forward to celebrating this historical moment with you!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pumpkinhead - Sloth 30th Anniversary Tour, Pumpkinhead celebrate the 30th anniversary of their critically acclaimed album Sloth this year, performing three exclusive never to be repeated reunion shows.

Sloth entered the New Zealand Album Charts on 30 April 1995, peaked at number 28 and stayed in the charts for 4 weeks. Their single “I Like” made it to number 16 in the Official Top 40 singles chart 10 March 1995.

“Now “Sloth”, Pumpkinhead’s debut album, compresses the quintet’s live energy into a head spinning whirlpool of fierce punky rock, powerful pop, and tempo-hopping Faith No More style metal. Not for the innocent!” – 4.5 stars – NZ HERALD 1995

“Sloth is the sound of a band that’s already found its feet, the sound of a band that’s played 500 gigs before recording their debut album. What we’ve got here is a classy, polished debut. “I Like” these songs a lot” – Kevin List – RIP IT UP 1995

description:
Queer Horizons presents Hot Mooch, Hot Mooch is a queer club night. Come to shake up koanga with a night of hot dance music. 
Spawned from the legendary Queer Horizons in Ōtautahi Christchurch, Hot Mooch is happening in te Upoko o te Ika Wellington - Valhalla to be exact - on 11 October. 
!!! THIS LINEUP !!!
🎶 DJ Thank U So Much (Te Whanganui-a-Tara)
🎶 Mr Meaty Boy (Ōtautahi)
🎶 AAKI (Ōtautahi)
🎶 Oil Grace (Tāmaki Makaurau)
Come to kanikani. Toi tū te Tiriti and free Palestine.
About Hot Mooch
Hot Mooch is for the bipoc and queer communities of Te Whanganui-a-Tara and their allies. It is intended as a night to dance and listen to loud music: in safety, as yourself, and with abandon. 
BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ front and centre: always.
Tino rangatiratanga: mō āke tonu atu.
FREE PALESTINE. 10% of sales go to Team Assal for their work supporting people in Gaza.
The night is dedicated to respectful, inclusive, and joyful space: we have no tolerance for any unsafe behaviour including racism, ableism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, fatphobia, or unwanted attention. 
Show lots of love and respect to our amazing performers and DJs and give them space to do their thing.
Take care of those around you, be aware of the space you inhabit and respect the needs of others. Ear plugs are available at the bar, and we encourage you to take time out, and check in with your friends. If you need help please ask the bar staff or organisers. 
  Accessibility details
Valhalla is wheelchair accessible with accessible toilets. If you have other accessibility needs, DM Abby on Insta @emmanuelcunnane
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird w/Mercy Lie, Araiyah, Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird w/Mercy Lie, Araiyah
Join us for a magical evening of music at Firebird Café, Levin.

Three amazing Wellington acts are coming through to present their beautiful sounds and share their heart and soul with you. We warmly invite you to join us and become a part of this collaboration of creativity and connection; spanning triumph and heartbreak, and everything in between, celebrating all it means to be human.

Our wonderful hosts at Firebird Café will be serving their delicious food and creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Tickets are $15 online or $20 on the door.

Mercy Lie:

Driving all night under the stars, along the highways of human experience, the original songs of Mercy Lie will haunt, surprise, remind and affirm.

Mercy Lie is the musical guise of Laura Chester-Murphy. An instinctive sound maker from an early age, Laura just wants to keep the music rolling. There’s a lot of sound from that little acoustic guitar and a voice to match. In the songs, you will find fierce independence, crushing vulnerability and a reflective wit that speaks to a life of figuring stuff out along the way.

With influences ranging across and not limited to folk, funk, country, goth, indie and 90’s rave, Laura puts the focus on crafting percussive earworms that won’t leave your head easily. The music of Mercy Lie is a unique soundscape, sculpted with ambience and depth, the silence unforgettably painted by explorations into the motivations of both the self and fellow travellers.

Mercy Lie is about connecting over the foibles of polite society and the ways we are wired to weave around each other.

Hometowns, journeys, mysteries, ghosts, growing up, messing up, speaking out, moving on. If you like getting nostalgic over something and nothing all at once, buckle up.

“Mercy Lie’s novel approach to the guitar and talent for songwriting make for the perfect storm.”
“I did not expect that voice to come from that mouth.”
“An acoustic delight!”

Araiyah & Izzy:

Born in the coastal town of Patea and raised in the vibrant community of Gisborne, Araiyah’s musical journey is as rich and diverse as her heritage. Now based in Wellington, she is not just a musician but a devoted mother of four tamariki and a proud grandmother to one mokopuna. For the past decade, Araiyah has poured her heart into writing, recording, and performing her original compositions, each note resonating with the depth of her experiences.

Araiyah’s music is a poignant reflection of her life’s journey, weaving together themes of love, loss, and resilience. Her deeply moving compositions are rooted in the lessons learned through relationships and the pain that often accompanies them. Through her art, she shares a narrative of healing, transformation, and the strength that comes from embracing vulnerability.

Influenced by a diverse array of artists such as Bic Runga, Tracy Chapman, and The Eagles, Araiyah’s sound is a fusion of heartfelt storytelling and melodic richness. However, it is her whanau and friends who serve as her greatest inspiration, fuelling her passion and creativity. Their support and love provide the foundation upon which her music thrives, making each performance an authentic expression of her gratitude and connection to those who matter most.

With a voice that captivates and lyrics that resonate, Araiyah invites listeners into her world—a place where pain transforms into beauty, and healing becomes a shared experience. As she continues to evolve as an artist, Araiyah’s music promises to touch the hearts of many, leaving a lasting impact on all who have the privilege of listening.

Araiyah will be accompanied by guitarist Izzy and Laura Chester-Murphy on percussion.

Rain and the Urban Bohemians:

Formed around the music of singer-songwriter Cathy Elizabeth aka Rain, supported by her band of Urban Bohemians, this group has been able to weave together many different influences and styles to create something quite unique and beautiful.

Peppered with contemplations of our existence and the fleetingness of time, Rain & the UBs bring the magic with a folk-rock edge and an alluring authenticity at its centre. Spiritual undertones and overtones give way to an uplifting joyfulness, of triumph over difficulties and life lessons learned and expressed through music.

With Cathy Elizabeth on vocals & acoustic guitar, Chris Ewers on bass, Murray James on drums and Izzy and Dion on guitars, these guys have got the goods and are ready to deliver!

So come along and allow yourself to be immersed and transported, moved and entertained. It’s going to be a very special night all round!
label: Music & Concerts

Tickets are $15 online or $20 on the door.

Araiyah & Izzy:

Born in the coastal town of Patea and raised in the vibrant community of Gisborne, Araiyah’s musical journey is as rich and diverse as her heritage. Now based in Wellington, she is not just a musician but a devoted mother of four tamariki and a proud grandmother to one mokopuna. For the past decade, Araiyah has poured her heart into writing, recording, and performing her original compositions, each note resonating with the depth of her experiences.

Araiyah’s music is a poignant reflection of her life’s journey, weaving together themes of love, loss, and resilience. Her deeply moving compositions are rooted in the lessons learned through relationships and the pain that often accompanies them. Through her art, she shares a narrative of healing, transformation, and the strength that comes from embracing vulnerability.

Influenced by a diverse array of artists such as Bic Runga, Tracy Chapman, and The Eagles, Araiyah’s sound is a fusion of heartfelt storytelling and melodic richness. However, it is her whanau and friends who serve as her greatest inspiration, fuelling her passion and creativity. Their support and love provide the foundation upon which her music thrives, making each performance an authentic expression of her gratitude and connection to those who matter most.

With a voice that captivates and lyrics that resonate, Araiyah invites listeners into her world—a place where pain transforms into beauty, and healing becomes a shared experience. As she continues to evolve as an artist, Araiyah’s music promises to touch the hearts of many, leaving a lasting impact on all who have the privilege of listening.

Araiyah will be accompanied by guitarist Izzy and Laura Chester-Murphy on percussion.

Rain and the Urban Bohemians:

Formed around the music of singer-songwriter Cathy Elizabeth aka Rain, supported by her band of Urban Bohemians, this group has been able to weave together many different influences and styles to create something quite unique and beautiful.

Peppered with contemplations of our existence and the fleetingness of time, Rain & the UBs bring the magic with a folk-rock edge and an alluring authenticity at its centre. Spiritual undertones and overtones give way to an uplifting joyfulness, of triumph over difficulties and life lessons learned and expressed through music.

With Cathy Elizabeth on vocals & acoustic guitar, Chris Ewers on bass, Murray James on drums and Izzy and Dion on guitars, these guys have got the goods and are ready to deliver!

So come along and allow yourself to be immersed and transported, moved and entertained. It’s going to be a very special night all round!

description:

Experience the vibrant rhythms, melodies, and traditions of Rapa Nui in this unique Music Workshop led by the Internationally renowned Cultural Performing Group Puku Rangi Tea from Easter Island.
Learn about the instruments, songs, and stories that have been passed down for generations, and feel the energy of one of the Pacific’s most captivating cultures. Whether you’re a musician, a culture lover, or simply curious, this workshop will inspire and connect people of all ages and backgrounds, no experience required.
Spaces are limited

More information at www.mmc.nz or follow the Marlborough Multicultural Centre on Facebook and Instagram.

description:
Ravel’s opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges', New Zealand School of Music Classical Performance students present four performances Ravel's engagingly magical opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges' at the Hannah Playhouse directed by Sara Brodie, conducted by Martin Riseley with the New Zealand School of Music orchestra.

Performed in French with subtitles, the show is suitable for all ages. The story involves a 'child' (L'enfant) whose awful behaviour brings an unexpected response: first the furniture rebels, the grandfather clock, the broken china cup, then the mathematics tutor and the Princess in the fairy tale book come to life, and eventually all the animals in the garden - squirrels, dragonfly, birds rise up - all of whom have good reason to 'teach the child a lesson'. It's a fabulous journey that we go on with the child who is confronted by all of these and indeed learns...

This is a project involving the whole of the Classical Performance programme: the voice students sing all the roles, each performing several roles, the NZSM orchestra will play for the performances, and the piano students are taking part as rehearsal pianists (répétiteurs) and playing in the orchestra.

Lighting design by Alex Fisher, set and costumes by Grace O’Brien, assistant director Theresa Hanaray, chorus master Kathryn Mosley, the show has been coordinated by NZSM Head of Classical Voice Jenny Wollerman in collaboration with the Toi Whakaari technical programme staff, graduates, and students

description:
Raven Mavens Quartette in concert, Raven Mavens Quartette
Suppose you can imagine the sound of the blues, spiced by flavours of the American songbook, folk, country, and even the rock and roll of Jerry Lee Lewis, driven by the unmistakable sound of boogie woogie piano. In that case, you have the Raven Mavens Quartette.  

It is both an accident and it isn’t that this is an all-female group. The group had its genesis a decade ago when piano player and singer-songwriter Cindy Muggeridge encountered the singing and clarinet skills of Marian Carter. They formed the Raven Mavens as a duo that included a core of folk and blues, and exploited the singing talents of the pair through finely crafted harmonies.  

The success of their combination in playing local gigs and folk festivals opened up opportunities with other musicians, and the next step was the inclusion of drummer Anje Glindemann, who has played in a list of local bands, including Tin Pan Alley, Hen Picked and more recently the Salty Hearts. Anje can also be seen performing with Kapiti Coast singer-songwriter icon Andrew London.  And finally, the addition of multi-instrumentalist Kate Marshall. “Kate is an amazing player”, Cindy says. “She can move as easily from piano accordion, to fiddle or flute, depending on what the song calls for - or she feels like playing!” And of course, like the other members of the group, she sings.  

The instrumental diversity of the line-up was now established, but what also distinguishes this group is the addition of Cindy Muggeridge’s original songs to the set. “Writing my own songs has been part of the musical journey for me”, says Cindy, “and it just led naturally to offering some of them to the other singers in the group”. The “fun” of their music and the unmistakable presence of four female musical masters is what they will be sharing when they play at The Offering as part of Greytown ArtTown.

Buy tickets in advance here or txt bookings to 02102361951.

Please note The Offering is fully licensed and will be serving snacks and drinks. Please note this concert replaces Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton due to illness.

description:
Rebel Base with Stanton Warriors tickets, The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London—raving, clubbing, DJing, and throwing parties.
He returned to Wellington in 2000 and co-founded the event brand Sandwiches that November.
By 2003, Sandwiches had grown into a venue that became an iconic part of Wellington’s nightlife for over a decade, hosting both local and international artists. The brand also expanded into large-scale events, including outdoor music festivals such as Summerset at the Basin Reserve.
Now, The Sandwiches Guy and Meow Nui are joining forces to bring back a classic favourite from the Sandwiches days: Stanton Warriors!
Doors open at 8 pm, with Stanton Warriors hitting the stage at 10 pm. This one-off event is all about community—friends old and new coming together to dance, connect, and celebrate. Don’t miss your chance to be part of a night to remember.

description:
Romi Wrights And Leao, This October, two of Aotearoa’s brightest talents come together for a one-night-only double headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
On Saturday, October 18th, 60s soul, funk, and R&B revivalists Romi Wrights & the Commotions join forces with fellow "niu-wave" sonic explorers LEAO for their debut headline performances in the capital.

Don’t miss this celebration of era-blending, electrifying Pacific journeys through sound.


LEAO

Formed from a Pacific heart, LEAO is a Samoan musical project led by guitarist/vocalist David Feauai-Afaese, joined by bassist Navakatoa Tekela-Pule, Hawaiian-steel guitarist Levi Gemmell, and drummer Larsen Tito-Taylor. With a deep adoration for Pacific musical reference points and a desire to explore new sonic ground, LEAO synthesises non-traditional tonalities with a fa‘asamoa spirit, creating what some have called “niu wave” and “Pacific neo-psychedelia.” A creative enigma and phenomenal live act since the release of their critically acclaimed debut GHOST ROADS in 2019, LEAO has continued to expand its vision with the 2024 single TAEAO / MEA UMA - a sparkling glimpse into a significant body of alternative Pacific music currently in development. The group is now actively working towards the release of a new full-length album, deepening their bold contribution to contemporary Pacific sound.



Romi Wrights

Although she grew up on the sensibilities of US RnB and Hip-hop, when the Tokelauan singer-songwriter Romi Wrights shares her voice, it’s hard not to feel transported back to the spirit of the late 1960s soul/funk era by her incandescent melodies and stirring stories of love, loss and the confusion that lies in between. Raised between Porirua and the Hutt Valley, Romi started writing diaristic poetry at age eight before beginning to set her words to music during her teenage years.



After finishing high school, she moved to Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland) to study music at the EXCEL School of Performing Arts and pursue her dreams of being a singer. Several years later she formed the gospel, funk and soul band The Elected, who spent three years performing at venues like Portland Public House, Kings Arms and Golden Dawn.


Since 2021, she has been working alongside Mānuka Recordings co-founder Kenny Sterling and a cast of session musicians and backing vocalists, including Julien Dyne, Cory Champion, Olivia Wilding, JY Lee. In December 2023, Wrights opened for soul legend Lee Fields, at the Hollywood Avondale, and has since performed twice at Pōneke festival CubaDupa. Via Mānuka Recordings, she has released 3 singles; Bring It Back, Without You and Capsized and has an album scheduled for release mid to late 2025.

Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.

Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.

Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.

“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine

Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.

Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.

“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor

You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.

Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.

Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand, tickets are on sale now from ticketek.co.nz

description:
SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt, SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

Presented by Goose Garden & Select Music
Following the release of their debut album TREK and a string of sold-out shows across Sydney (Eora), Brisbane (Meanjin), and Melbourne (Naarm), Sydney post-punk trio Shady Nasty announce their debut tour in Aotearoa/New Zealand this September. A world bound by modding cars, immigrant heritage and digital obsessions, Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green and Luca Watson, together play a left-field breed of punk that recalibrates their formal training to its most uncustomary extremes. Wherever they play and no matter the room size, devout adherents clammer to propel a heaving mosh. Experience TREK live as Shady Nasty debut the record with an all-new live show, with special guests to be announced.
• Valhalla, Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington, 12th September
• Whammy Bar, Tāmaki Makaurau / Auckland, 13th September

Date: Friday, September 12, 2025
Doors Open: 5:00 PM
Venue: Arise Church, 3 Pito-One Road, Korokoro, Lower Hutt 5012

Presented by Silhouette Productions NZ Limited, Broken Glass Productions and Infinity & Beyond Productions Inc., this event is part of the band’s Down Under Tour 2025.

With a legacy of timeless hits and soulful performances, South Border has touched audiences across generations. This special evening offers fans in New Zealand the rare opportunity to experience their music live — up close and personal.

Whether you're reconnecting with the songs you love or discovering them for the first time, this concert promises an atmosphere of warmth, energy, and musical brilliance.

This is the regular ticket price for full access to South Border Live in Wellington.

description:
Sam Bambery - Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Sam Bambery - Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs
Sam Bambery is an artist and impresario from Ōtautahi/Christchurch, currently based in Naarm/Melbourne. Exploring his love of semi-psychedelia through a twisted folk-rock lens, Bambery writes effectual and spacious songs burrowing into emotional identity and exhaustion. His sophomore album Rubricator released in 2024 with micro-label Under Underground Records, edging at outsider-pop influence.


"...very considered, like Bambery lived with the album in his head for a while before bringing it into the world...a hint of mystery hangs over things...it's as ornate as these well-crafted tunes" - Tony Stamp, Radio New Zealand

"Rubricator confirms the emergence of a real talent" - Graham Reid, NZ Listener

Sam Bambery is joined by Michael Llewellyn
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Scarlet Duo, As part of Jazz in Martinborough, Margrain Vineyard has the wonderful Scarlet duo playing at our Cellar Door and Kitchen. A retro acoustic jazz duo with soulful singer Amanda Hanna-Doull and top-class guitarist Andy Mauafua. From sultry ballads to sassy 60's jazz & pop, Scarlet inject every song with their unique flavour and soul.

What a way to spend your Sunday, with live music from 11am to 1pm, pizzas and platters available, and Margrain's fabulous wines and gins.

Cellar Dwellers also running during September, Margrain Gin & Cheese specials, and accommodation packages. See more info at https://margrainvineyard.co.nz/pages/spring

Bookings recommended. https://margrainvineyard.co.nz/pages/kitchen
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Schubert Octet with Aroha String Quartet and Friends, For this programme we are joined by four wonderful guest artists - Nick Walshe (clarinet), Justin Sun (bassoon), Alexander Hambleton (horn) and Oleksandr Gunchenko (double bass) - to present a programme enlivened by the varied timbres of wind instruments.

Beginning with the Mozart String Quartet in B-flat K589 we move on to 'Serenata in vano' for Clarinet, Bassoon, Horn, Cello & Double Bass by Danish composer Carl Nielsen. This characterful work depicts a short and unsuccessful attempt at seduction. We finish with Schubert's mighty and virtuosic Octet, a work filled with jaunty dances, singable melodies and heart-rending moments.

Aroha String Quartet:
Haihong Liu & Konstanze Artmann - violins
Zhongxian Jin - viola
Robert Ibell - cello
Acclaimed as demonstrating "accomplished brilliance, soulfulness and sublime intensity in perfect balance and tonal unity" (The Dominion Post), the Aroha String Quartet is firmly established as one of New Zealand's finest chamber music ensembles. Founded in 2004, this versatile Wellington-based quartet is known for its passionate musicality, impressive technique, and multicultural innovation.

Nick Walshe - clarinet
Nick Walshe is a clarinettist, music teacher and arts administrator based in Te Whanganui a Tara/Wellington. He is currently section principal clarinet with Orchestra Wellington, and co-principal clarinet with the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and also maintains a busy studio of clarinet and saxophone students, privately and in high schools.Nick works as a freelance musician for organisations such as the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Stroma New Music Ensemble, and the Capital Theatre Trust.

Justin Sun - bassoon
Justin was born and raised in Canberra, Australia, and began playing the bassoon at age 12. After completing his studies in 2018, he was appointed Principal Bassoon of the Aarhus Symphony Orchestra in Denmark, where he worked for 3 years before being appointed Associate Principal Bassoon of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra in 2021. He has performed as guest principal with many orchestras worldwide, including Sydney Symphony, Australian Opera and Ballet, Scottish Chamber, Royal Philharmonic and BBC Symphony.

Alexander Hambleton - horn
Before joining the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Alex studied and worked in the UK and Sweden.
Alex spent eight years as a member of the Gothenburg Opera Orchestra, in addition to touring and recording with the Swedish Chamber Orchestra.

Oleksandr Gunchenko - double bass
Oleksandr was born in Kiev, Ukraine, where he studied at Lysenko School of Music and Tchaikovsky Conservatory. He became a member of the National Philharmonic Symphony Orchestra at the age of 19 and at the age of 20 gained a position with the National Chamber Orchestra of Ukraine. Oleksandr joined the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra in 2007. He is a member of the contemporary ensemble Stroma, and also regularly performs solo recitals.

Seth Boy's BigBoyBand, Presenting a range of his eclectic compositions and arrangements in an organ quartet format, Talbot promises to bring his music’s trademark humour and energy to the gig.
Joining Frank to complete a tremendous band are Jack Harré on trumpet, Ayrton Foote on keyboard, and Sean Anderson on drums.
You don’t want to miss this gig!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shades Of Madlib, Join us for a night at the Rogue and Vagabond where the sampler becomes the stage to pay tribute to one of the greatest, Madlib.

Madlib has more aliases than most artists have albums. You can expect some deep cuts and classics. Get ready for a real inception, dream-inside-a-dream type experience.

With Chris CK on the mic alongside Blair Gowan (keys), Will Hanlon (sax), Max Sheehan (percussion & effects), Ciaran Egan (drums), and Alex Cooper (bass), this band will take you deep into the crate for a groove-filled night you won’t forget!

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shady Nasty, Debut Aotearoa Shows, Following the release of their debut album TREK and a string of sold-out shows across Sydney (Eora), Brisbane (Meanjin), and Melbourne (Naarm), Sydney post-punk trio Shady Nasty announce their debut tour in Aotearoa/New Zealand this September.

A world bound by modding cars, immigrant heritage and digital obsessions, Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green and Luca Watson, together play a left-field breed of punk that recalibrates their formal training to its most uncustomary extremes.

Wherever they play and no matter the room size, devout adherents clammer to propel a heaving mosh. Experience TREK live as Shady Nasty debut the record with an all-new live show, with special guests to be announced.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shane And The Warmen, Auckland Saxophonist, Shane Warman, is excited to present 'Shane and the Warmen' live at Seatoun Bowling Club

The band draws inspiration from jazz greats such as John Coltrane, Phil Woods, Robert Glasper, Cannonball Adderley, Kenny Garrett, and many more, so keep an eye out for some of their tunes in the set. Featuring six talented musicians, this is a performance not to be missed!

The Seatoun Bowling Club is a historic venue offering social events and community gatherings in Wellington’s eastern suburbs, where better to spend a Sunday afternoon listening to one of the closing acts of the Wellington Jazz Festival.

Personnel:
Shane Warman - Alto Saxophone
Samuel Voyle - Tenor Saxophone
Bill Liu - Guitar
Thomas David - Piano
Minjoon Kim - Bass
Thomas Christie - Drums

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!), Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!)
🚨LESS THAN 30 TICKETS REMAINING!🚨

More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/41W7UR4

With special guest: Nick Herbison

Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Simple Gifts, Hutt City Chorale are delighted to present “Simple Gifts”. Join us at St James for an entertaining afternoon of uplifting spirituals, beautiful folk songs and other delights.

We have a wonderful collection of beautiful songs to present to you. We will be accompanied by our amazingly talented pianist Phillip O’Malley and our knowledgeable, creative music director Jonathan Berkahn.

Join us afterwards for a delicious afternoon tea. Tickets can be purchased via our email huttcitychorale@gmail.com or cash/online banking at the door on the day. Bring a friend for an afternoon that is sure to please. We look forward to singing to you.

description:
Sing & Fling, Join JoJo Bellini for an evening of epic sauciness and song!

Sing & Fling is more than just a burlesque show. Every single performer will be singing live on stage as they shimmy and shake their tassels for you!

Harking back to the glamour of Vaudeville with a modern twist, this evening of burlesque and song will tease and delight you with voices dripping with velvet and costumes devine!

With performances by , Ms Weeds, Billie Bountiful, Willy Smack'n'Tush, Victor Victorious, Breathless La Belle, Hester Hawthorne and Velma Cherry!

All door sales $35 if the show is not sold out prior.

description:
Sir Dave Dobbyn - Selected Songs, All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

Please note: There is no elevator in the Opera House and access to the Dress Circle and Gallery are via stairs. The Gallery may be unsuitable for patrons with accessibility requirements or experience vertigo. For further information, please contact us on 04 916 1205.

Child Policy:
This event is all ages, all patrons must hold a valid ticket for entry.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sir Dave Dobbyn — Selected Songs, He’s a treasured musical voice in New Zealand culture. Sir Dave Dobbyn has over 45 years of experience as a singer, songwriter, and recording artist. For one special night, he will be singing in Wellington at The Opera House. Many of his songs have acted as a backdrop to Kiwis’ lives and shaped the sound of the country’s popular music scene. Some of Dave’s songs are so famous that they have become anthems. You’ll get to hear many of them along with rich pickings from his back catalogue. 
Diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease in 2022, Dave declared it “business as usual” — and continues to inspire with his unmistakable voice and enduring stage presence. Recognised with a Knighthood in 2021 for his services to music, Dave remains one of New Zealand’s most revered cultural figures.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sirens: LadyReign, Edera, Cryfor, LadyReign presents SIRENS on the 17th Sept 2025 at Valhalla Tavern, featuring three of Wellington's most eclectic female fronted artists: LadyReign, Cryfor & Edera.
With a lineup designed to increase in intensity, the tunes of these baddies will make you cry, headbang and two-step. At the same time you ask? Come find out.
Edera is an alt-rock–indie–sad girl artist from Te Whanganui-a-Tara, delivering romantic yet callous songwriting that makes you want to dance, cry, and maybe do both at once. Ederacore blends lush indie textures with gritty rock energy, brought to life by melancholy rock legends Aidan Thomas-Inwood (guitar), Lily Hodgson-Bell (bass), and Taiki Yoshino (drums) - Together, they create an immersive live experience—intimate, cathartic, and impossible to forget.
LadyReign is a six-piece alternative-metal band blending soul-stirring harmonies with the raw
intensity of heavy metal breakdowns. Fronted by two powerful female vocalists, the band
creates a captivating contrast that draws inspiration from both soulful icons like Lianne La
Havas and the crushing heaviness of bands like Spiritbox. LadyReign fuses vulnerability with
aggression in a sound that is both haunting and refreshing.
With their fearless blend of metal and soul, LadyReign is a band that leaves an unforgettable
mark on the Wellington and wider Aotearoa music scene.
In faith to the literal etymology of the term 'metalcore', Cryfor combines Bridge 9, Deathwish era hardcore with golden era melodic death metal. As hard as they are brutal, Cryfor aims to bring real deal spin kickers and battle jacket bros together in the same pit.
Originally starting as the bedroom recording project of vocalist and lyricist Ella O'Neill, Cryfor is a band dedicated to reviving and breathing new life into 2000s style metalcore.
After recruiting drummer Fionn Lawley, and guitarist/backing vocalist Daniel Jenner (ex King Hit HC & Temperatures Rising) in late 2024 and bassist Daniel Walters in early 2025, Cryfor has been a rolling tank of non-stop hatemosh force.
label: Music & Concerts

After months in the lab at MOSH SCIENCE HQ, Cryfor release 'The Winter Demo', and has since punished Valhalla, San Fran, Thistle Hall and Underworld Tavern with fuck you mosh parts of toughness, vocals or sheer brutality and ancient melodies foretold by prophets of evil... and that's only the start.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Soft Bait - Life Advice Album Release Tour (Wellington), Tāmaki Makaurau post-punk outfit Soft Bait are hitting the road this September in celebration of their new album Life Advice, out July 25 via Flying Nun Records.
Known for their sharp lyricism, driving basslines and chaotic-but-considered live shows, the four-piece are bringing their wiry energy and weird charm to stages across the motu. Life Advice is a hook-heavy record full of tightly wound rhythms, jagged guitars and lines that sound like overheard wisdom from a mate you probably shouldn’t be listening to.
Tickets on sale now.
With support from Buffcat and True Mets.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Songwriter Showcase 106, Every 3rd Sunday of the month we showcase four local songwriters and celebrate the rich culture and depth of talent we have here in Aotearoa.

This month we present.. The Vorn String Trio, Emily de Vegt, CP3o, and Banjo Ben and the Breeze


The Vorn String Trio..
Wellington songwriting legend Vorn needs no introduction! But since I have to write something in this box and you seem compelled to read it, let’s both reflect on the wonder of a 25-year career spent labouring in prolific obscurity, across 9 albums of songs which veer from sublime to ridiculous, often within a single verse. Fresh off releasing The Late Album (the only NZ indie album ever to beat terminal cancer), Vorn and the ludicrously talented Charley Davenport (cello) and Thomas Liggett (violin) will present a selection of the best songs ever written in this country. You should come listen!

https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/a-safe-pair-of-hands
https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/all-along-the-shore
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MqYKO64nHuM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L7CoOPc6AX8
https://www.facebook.com/Vornmusic/

Emily de Vegt..
Taranaki’s Emily de Vegt brings a cosy, whimsical charm to the girl-with-a-guitar flavour of singer-songwriter. Her songs draw from her background in classical piano and pay tribute to melancholic modern artists like Radiohead and Lana Del Rey.

https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/birds-hawera-2023
https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/somygardengrows-hawera-2023
https://facebook.com/emilydevegt/videos/718456777591120

CP3o..
Barry Carter's CP3o give you original songs with a Jazz-Acana feel.

https://www.youtube.com/@CarterParkerTrio-CP3o/videos
https://www.facebook.com/people/CP3o-Carter-Parker-Trio/100091844075290


Banjo Ben and the Breeze
Banjo Ben and The Breeze are a new 4-piece indie-folk comedy band based in Wellington,
NZ. They are known for their iconic beanies, their regular evening busking sessions on
Cuba Street, and their theatrically charged gigs which are packed full of catchy lyrics, wild
stories and plenty of laughs.

https://youtu.be/ejM7pZYBMYI?si=Rc_CSQEt2zQYvewW
https://www.instagram.com/banjo_ben_and_the_breeze
https://www.facebook.com/people/Banjo-Ben-and-The-Breeze/61578992621362/

description:
Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown, To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.
